Reviews.Title: “Mneh”
Reviews.Author: DB4SB
Reviews.Content: Got to admit I am not a fan of this place. It is good in the sense that there is a metro station right below but the area it is situated in is quite dodgy, I don't feel safe at all and would much prefer to be in a more central location like el gotic (gothic quarter) or l'eixample. Also felt hotel staff were quite rude and I picked this hotel based on the fact I thought it had a gym which it advertises it has however, what they fail to tell you is the gym is separate and you need to pay 10euro per visit. Wasn't happy about that false advertising... Plus rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “modern.clean.comfortable.perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: ahrgne
Reviews.Content: A well-designed hotel with modern, space-themed interiors. Had a very pleasant stay at Barcelo Sants. Room is well-maintained and the sheets are perfectly clean and smells good. The room that we've stayed in has quite a view as well. Subway is like 5mins away. Recommended! Will definitely stay here again.:-)

Reviews.Title: “Groovy!”
Reviews.Author: EboracumYork
Reviews.Content: Loved this space themed hotel in Barcelona. Just above Sants station so perfect if you are heading on somewhere by train.

Reviews.Title: “Black & White Consept Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HADogan
Reviews.Content: I and My Wife stayed for 4 nights and we felt very safe and comfortable here. We were 100% happy with my stay at Barcelo Sants. The room have been recently renovated to a space-orbital theme. The room was clean, comfortable beds, comfortable desk, reliable wireless internet, large TV with many international channels, and more! The shower has a large, high-pressure rain shower head which is awesome. Two sings are located outside of the bathroom. There is a lockbox/safe that has a pullout drawer big. Several outlets for your electronics, small refrigerator, wood bed tables to work or eat in bed. Alarm clock with iphone/ipod dock, automatic blinds (goes up and down with button). The staff at the front desk are very helpful. The location is PERFECT. I took the train from the airport and it lets you off right at Sants Estacio which is immediately below this hotel. Once you arrive at Sants Estacio, just follow the signs upstairs and your hotel is there! Unfortunately, lift is closed after mid-night. There are lifts to the lobby and rooms so you don't have to haul your luggage up stairs. If you want to see the sights, the Barcelona Bus Turistico (Hop On/Hop Off Bus) is just across the street so it's super easy to walk to (1 minute) and see the sights of Barcelona! You can buy tickets on the bus or there's a Turismo desk inside the train station. They also can provide you with a lot of information. If you don't take the tourist bus, you can take the Metro (also at Sants Estacio) to La Rambla, Placa Catalunya, and more (Green Line). The purple line takes you directly to La Sagrada Familia! You can buy 1 way ticket, day ticket, 2 day ticket, etc. If you're going to be using metro/trains a lot, I recommend you buy the 3 day pass from the Barcelona Turismo desk - You will save a little money. The train station has basic amenities: food, snacks, ATM, shops, etc. for basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: KLJdolphin
Reviews.Content: I was 100% happy with my stay at Barcelo Sants. All of the rooms have been recently renovated to a space-orbital theme. I was traveling to another part of Spain for business but decided to stay a few days in Barcelona for holiday. I was traveling solo and felt very safe and comfortable here. The room was perfectly clean, comfortable beds, comfortable desk with nice city view to do your work, reliable wireless internet, large TV with many international channels, and more! The shower has a large, high-pressure rain shower head which is awesome. The bathroom overall was very spacious. There is a lockbox/safe that has a pullout drawer big enough to fit my MacBook Pro (15")! Several outlets for your electronics, small refrigerator, wood bed tables to work or eat in bed. Alarm clock with iphone/ipod dock, automatic blinds (goes up and down with button). The staff at the front desk are very helpful. I forgot my adapter and they let me borrow one. You can print your boarding pass at the front desk too. Room service was a little pricey, but fast and efficient. The location is PERFECT. I took the train from the airport and it lets you off right at Sants Estacio which is immediately below this hotel. It cost 3.6 euros one way. Once you arrive at Sants Estacio, just follow the signs upstairs and your hotel is there! There are lifts to the lobby and rooms so you don't have to haul your luggage up stairs. If you want to see the sights, the Barcelona Bus Turistico (Hop On/Hop Off Bus) is just across the street so it's super easy to walk to (1 minute) and see the sights of Barcelona! You can buy tickets on the bus or there's a Turismo desk inside the train station. They also can provide you with a lot of information. If you don't take the tourist bus, you can take the Metro (also at Sants Estacio) to La Rambla, Placa Catalunya, and more (Green Line). The purple line takes you directly to La Sagrada Familia! You can buy 1 way ticket, day ticket, 2 day ticket, etc. If you're going to be using metro/trains a lot, I recommend you buy the 3 day pass from the Barcelona Turismo desk - You will save a little money. The train station has basic amenities: food, snacks, ATM, shops, etc. for basic needs. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: Clean, smart rooms with everything we needed. Poor sound proofing between rooms. Based above main station so good links via metro.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Godsgloriousworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a city break. Nice hotel, although I would say more of a really nice three and a half star than four. Nice easy journey from the airport, only took about 20 mins by train and cost less than 2 euros per person. Very convenient as hotel is above the Station. Reception staff were very helpful and spoke great English. Room was clean, small, but neatly laid out. The only think I didn’t like was that there was no enclosed bathroom. The toilet was enclosed and their was a door to the shower but the sink are only had a small glass panel separating it from the room and there was no private dressing area. It was fine as I was with my husband but wouldn’t have wanted to be sharing with a colleague or friend. We were on the 5th floor with a nice view of the city and could even see Sargarda Familia from our window. Kettle, tea (herbal, no English breakfast), coffee & cream was provided as were toothbrushes, shower caps, shaving kit, bath gel etc. There’s even an ice machine in the lobby. Housekeeping kept forgetting to leave our mugs and coffee when they tidied the room and on one occasion they away a bag with all our snacks. Only real negative is that room was a bit chilly and seemed to take forever to heat up.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well situated”
Reviews.Author: ka46ge
Reviews.Content: As other reviews say, the location is excellent. There's direct access to the station, it's a twenty minute journey to and from the airport, and there's a train every half-hour. There's a Metro just across the road and Nou Camp is an easy walk away, as is the Placa D'Espanya and the National Museum of Art. Getting to the hotel foyer is via an inconspicuous doorway outside and at the front of the station, and the lifts are less than impressive, but the foyer itself is big and airy, if a bit soulless. A few palms wouldn't go amiss. The rooms have recently been refurbished, and whilst on the small side (at least the basic Orbital room was anyway) are attractive, comfortable and quiet, with nicely designed lighting. The shower tended to fluctuate between hot and cold in a random sort of way. The restaurant is closed Sat and Sun, but when it's open during the week the food is excellent, as is the service. Bar food and service is equally good, with a satisfyingly wide range of spirits available, but check the prices of them before you order. A major negative for me was breakfast. It's the usual buffet type with all the cold stuff around the perimeter and the hot dishes on a central island, but it's quite obvious that the chef cooks a batch of food and then goes back to bed, for when a dish empties, it isn't replaced/refilled. Having paid for cooked breakfasts, I was only able to get what I wanted on one of the three days I was there. However, breakfast, or lack of it, aside, this is a good, reasonably priced hotel, and I'd stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access”
Reviews.Author: Brian F
Reviews.Content: barcelo sants is ideally located above the main station to and from the airport. it also has great links to the metro and you can get to anywhere in Barcelona in only a short time. the hotel itself is very modern and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. we have been here before and would choose this one again due to its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHLTraveler515
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to BCN in October 2011 with another couple and chose this property. We were very happy as this hotel also serves as a transporation hub for taxi, the metro, Renfe, and the hop on city tour bus lines. We took the train from the airport directly to the hotel. Check in was a breeze. We liked the space theme. The walls were thin, but not something that should be concerning unless you or your neighbors are partying too much. We did not stay in the room much, because we wanted to explore the town. Barcelona is fantastic. 5 days simply was not enough to see everything on our list. So fortunately for us, we have to go back in a few years to check everything off the list :^). The highlights of our trip were Montserrat, Sagrada Familia and the Boqueria.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it a lot - good location++”
Reviews.Author: ebbe1983
Reviews.Content: This hotels is situated on top of the Estacion Sans, and they are currently renovating, so it was a little messy in the lobby, but it looked so much better just during the days of our stay. The room was big enough with all we needed. Nice shower and a big, big, bed:) We found this hotel to big a great experience and i bet it will be better when the renovating is done. Still the bar and the restaurant area needs a little work, but the lobby and the room looked great. Btw - easy access to the Metro and the train station. There is also plentiful of taxis right outside. If you also want to take a hop on and off bus, both companies running have a stop right outside the hotel. Easy peasy:) We would love to stay there again if we ever visit Barca again.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: tzili
Reviews.Content: The first moment you get there you want to go to another hotel. A very ugly industrial location on the train station. The lobi is small and depressing. The hotel has a stupid childish moto of a space ship which could have been OK if it was located in Dysney World...the pros are that the rooms are modern and comfortable although small. A big problem is the tualet that is located centraly and cant be closed properly so you have to share the smells and small noises of your activities there...important tip: when you take the subway that is located under the hotel, start always with the Blue L5 line and not the green L3, and change the lines at Diagonal station. It will save you a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Self-conciously modern”
Reviews.Author: Treemonisha
Reviews.Content: Located on top of the main Barcelona train station (Sants) means great connections to the airport, the rest of Spain, and public transport in Barcelona. Fancy spaceship rooms. Great breakfast. Very comfortable experience, even if a would choose a more interesting part of the city the next time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location over the Metro and Train Station”
Reviews.Author: kateherms
Reviews.Content: We chose Barcelo Sants based on it's location above the metro and train station and were not disappointed. It's a fantastic launching point for site-seeing around the city as well as other destinations by train. There is not much in the neighborhood surrounding the hotel itself, but we didn't mind that at all as we just hopped on the metro. The rooms are really niec and we enjoyed the orbital theme. The only criticism is that our room on the 6th floor was too warm and the A/C did not seem able to keep up (and this was in January...). A lower floor might have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Another win for Barceló”
Reviews.Author: Nikki012
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times now, and have returned home this morning from another perfect stay. I always stay here when in Barcelona, as I really do love the Barcelo brand and the location of this hotel is perfect - built on top of the main barcelona sants train station. With direct access to the airport, trains, metro, busses, taxis, tourist bus you name it! I was in room 617 which is one of the newly refurbished orbital rooms - and it didnt disappoint. There was a huge king size bed (i am over 6ft tall and i could lie in this at many angles and there was still room!!) it came with 6 pillows, a big flat screen TV on the wall with a huge choice of channels, an ipod docking station and speakers, the comfiest leather chair in the window which provides some stunning views of the city, electric blind, a rainfall shower, slippers, mini bar, you name it it was there! The room was beyond immaculatly clean i could not fault one thing! I had another friend in the city who came to my hotel and he said next time he will definitely be staying here! I have never eaten in the restaurant or used the bar etc... here so i cannot comment but if it is anything like the rest of this hotel i am sure it will be fab.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location , Perfect Room”
Reviews.Author: sengkangboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sants for 4 nights and the experience is awesome. First of all,the location is just above the train station. We arrived via train from Nimes and it was so easy to just check in without having to carry the luggage and move around to find the hotel ( if you know what i mean ). There is a lift to the hotel just right outside the train station. You cant missed it, there are signs within the train station to direct you. The rooms are new and renovated. As everyone said , it is "orbital"... space theme. 2 basins outside the shower area, 42" flat screen , FREE WIFI. Metro station just below and direct trains to most of the key attractions in barcelona. Front staff is friendly, we pay addition 10 euros to extend till 2pm . Train to airport is also just below! THere is a supermarket just outside the station, check with the front staff if you are not sure.

Reviews.Title: “cant be more happier with orbital room”
Reviews.Author: sandy-lnhl
Reviews.Content: the reception area and lounge bit tired as it is not renovated but the orbital room was so gorgeous...very very happy with the overall room, clean, comfy bed, great gadget tv and love the ameneties. happy!! be back and so convenient as it is next to central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Orbital experience”
Reviews.Author: acisclo71
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, recently renovated. Spacious rooms with nice amenities (42" TV, complementary WIFI, etc.) Nice location for business and University, immediate access to Metro and Train. 20 min from airport by train and 15 min to City center by metro. Excellent last minute offer got me a very good deal, less expensive than 3 stars nearby hotels. I was visiting the University, so it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “of to space”
Reviews.Author: RTBMamallapuram
Reviews.Content: very well done up rooms and hotel. It was impressive, that my friend who stayed somewhere else in the city, shifted to Barcelo sants due to the facility of the room and the convenience of the hotel. felt comfortable in all ways and the team at the reception was informative at all times. I enjoyed being at the Barcelo Sants.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Train Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Sants Station and were only in town for one night, so we decided to book this hotel. Very easy to find - just followed the signs from the train station to the elevator up to the lobby. We bought a day pass for the Metro and it was easy to get around the city. The Metro station is in the same building. Room was good sized, clean, modern and quiet. The bathroom shower had great water pressure (but you needed to step in and out of a tub). The bathroom sinks were separate from the room that the shower/toilet were in, making it easier for two people to get ready. The room has a safe which was like a drawer - easier to get items in and out and see that you haven't forgotten anything. We didn't opt for breakfast but it was being offered for 10 euro/person. Friendly, fast checkin and checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: harry180702
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I've stayed in the Barcelo Sants. I usually stay here due to it location. Far enough awaya from the heart of Barcelona but only 5-10 minutes away on the Subway. On previous visits I have found the hotel to be clean and comfortable although maybe the decor was just a little dated. However, the hotel has undergone a bit of a revamp and the we had the pleasure of satying in one of the Orbital Rooms....oh my god.....these rooms are suberb. Very cosy and modern. The bed in huge and one of the best I have came across in any hotel. The rain shower is another great addition and the 42" plasma screen TV is another added bonus. Barcelona can be very warm (even in November) but it was great to get back after a day out to a beautiful clean room. The location of the hotel could not be better. It sits right on top of the main train station in Barcelona, Sants. The train from the airport will have you there in 20 minutes and the entrance to the hotel is via a lift that can be found just outside the station. This is also a great base to explore the beautiful city of Barcelona. The Camp Nou is only 5 minutes away via the subway with the Placa Catalunya and Sagrada familia only 10 minutes away. There is a good supermarket facing the hotel for stocking up on supplies (much cheaper than the Divers in the station) as well as a Pan's & Co across the street. The service at the hotel was great as well. Room cleaned every day and the front desk staff went out of their way to help us with info on restaurants etc. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. Great rooms, great staff, great location and a great price. We hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for late night train arrivals”
Reviews.Author: paddie58
Reviews.Content: As we were arriving very late in Barcelona by train from Paris, we booked into Barcelona Sants. Clean, modern room, great shower and very comfortable bed. Very helpful staff for directions and helping us get a sim card for our phone. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: RamsgateKevin
Reviews.Content: Excellent views, enormous and very comfortable beds / rooms. Service is generally good but the bar / coffee lounge area is understaffed when busy and attention is therefore slow / non existent.

Reviews.Title: “nice design hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mengbei
Reviews.Content: it locates above the subway and train station. so it's convenient to go by subway to everywhere you want. room design is nice, very chip, with designer lounge chair, and open wash basin area. And the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. She spent 20 mins to help me book the musical tickets over phone. Overall, i like this place. would recommend it. It would be even better if the current rant including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “After visiting 20 hotels in a year and half, this was the most disappointing”
Reviews.Author: doc111872
Reviews.Content: On the postitive side the location of this hotel is very convenient, it is located directly above the metro. I stayed at 6 different hotels in Spain and over 14 different hotels in the last year and a half and this is by far the most disappointing experience I've had. I was at the reception desk a couple of times, and each time the staff was extremely rude. I ordered room service and paid €16.50 for a pizza which never mind wasn't hot, it wasn't even cooked, the dough was raw. (Of all the hotels I stayed at, this had by far the most expensive room service menu, so I was extremely upset having paid that amount of money for the pizza). I had to throw out a glass of wine from a bottle I purchased because I didn't think to smell the glass before pouring it, silly me. All of the glasses in the room had a funny smell and weren't clean so I had to wash them out with shampoo. The lighting in the hallway was extremely dark, and I get that is on par with the design of the hotel, but there is supposed to be lighting behind the room number to illuminate it, which wasn't working all down my hallway so you could barely see the room numbers. I wouldn't have been so harsh on my review but the encounters with the rude people at reception was enough to make me really dislike this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK-location & service and a nice room”
Reviews.Author: jungleberry
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel as other hotels were fully booked for the wkend I was in Barcelona. Locationwise, it is very easy to find as it is on top of the main trainstation. However, if you are planning to take a cab, this would be the WORST place to stay. Apparently in Barcelona, they charge extra 2.1EUR if you get on from major train stations. So on our way to the airport, we had to pay 2.1EUR for the train station and then 3.5EUR (or something like that). I would rather stay at another hotel located more in the center - Plaza Catalunya etc. Hotel lobby seems a bit old but room was all modern and clean. Plus they offer free Wifi and toiletries so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelo Barcelona Sants”
Reviews.Author: VSPE
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Barcelona is ultramodern style hotel with unusual design. Its located on top of Sant railroad station. Being on a top floor - you dont hear a thing. Also, there are very little noise is coming from street - thanks to the high end window material. Being on top of railroad and metro station has its own pluses such as easy transportation and transportation in Barcelona works good. Room was sparkling clean - white and dark green walls with black ceiling make it very cosmic. The bed is clean white and modern white sink is next to the bed. 32 inches flat screern TV is on the wall. Very interesting design. Each of the bed in a room has 3 different pillows - chouse your style. Anywhere - place is very clean. Staff is friendly. Wi-fi is of acceptable, but not the greatest quality (2 bars out of 5 on Window 7). The breakfast 10E has good variety and quality and worst its money. Also after staying in hotel for 3 days I saw the same food, which is nothing wrong - we are not staying for a weeks and this is breakfast only, you can go downstairs and its at least 4 places to have breakfast at railroad station. If i would to stay in this hotel again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, right above the transport hub.”
Reviews.Author: FredoDido71
Reviews.Content: We spent our first Barcelona experience with 4 nights of stay with this hotel. At first we have so much concerns over it's location, worry that it might not in the heart of the city. Soon we found out that the metro rides were easy reach to all major attractions. No sweats. No comments on their buffet meals as we never try any. Nor the gym or other facilities. Below are our commetns: - Plus: Room rate was reasonably priced, newly renovated & clean room, with coffee/tea making facilities, well design bathroom where water didn't splash all over the place after shower. Minus: water temperature in shower room or basin could be more sensitive with response to the controller, few English channels on TV, our room was the last room at the end of the long building(quite a walk..), last but not least, the hotel main lobby at ground floor need a major upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Ace single holiday at user friendly great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: heachy
Reviews.Content: For anyone who's always wanted to go away but hasnt anyone to go with i encourage you all to do it alone! Boy was I scared! Boy had i deliberated (as people on this site will know!) - i had split from a long term ex, found myself alone and all my friends were in couples and was sick of missing out (as i hadnt been away for 16 years!). Believe me, i'm not a huge confident person but taking the jump (and managing it!) really did me the world of good and once you do it, you'll never look back! The Barcelo Sants, where i stayed, simply added to all of that. Price was excellent through expedia / flight with monarch but the service was fantastic - a big king size bed all to myself, rooms were large and well equipped and maintenance of rooms couldnt be faulted. I know there are quite a few bad reviews but since Barcelo started renovating the hotel you cant fault it really. Bathroom lovely with free toiletries, nice clean fluffy towels, large TV on the wall, nice big wardrobe and safe. Ideal location for someone who doesnt really want to get taxis everywhere (and wants to be a little out of the centre) - metro, train etc is all easy to get as the hotel is above the main train station and its literally a 10 minute journey into town on the extremely efficient metro. The lady at check in even showed me which metro to get and advised me on the different lines / tickets which really helped. The only real let down was the gym - firstly its not free to residents of the hotel and not air conditionned and the machines are archaic / from the dark ages and i personally found it quite chauvanistic (its a very mans mans gym if you know what i mean!). HOtel aside, Barcelona is an amazing place - so much culture and so much to see and even though i was only there 2 nights, i fitted in so much (and espanya is only a short walk from the hotel at night which has a lovely big shopping centre and is a real hub of activity). Admittedly there arent many toilets (that was a big of a problem as alot of the cafes say striictly for customers) but the market has one for 40 cents and El Cortes WC is hidden in the corner of the top floor. Singles, embrace the singledom and just do it - yes, there are times along the way you do get scared or panic but you then embrace it and get on with it and get such a tremendous feeling from managing on your own

Reviews.Title: “Very underated hotel, Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: XspeedstarX
Reviews.Content: Have been to Barcelona a few times now and this was by far the best hotel we've stayed at. Very friendly and courteous staff. Rooms are good sized, modern and clean and quiet. Fantastic location for the city sightseer with it being directly above the train station and all the tour bus stops are right outside. The Metro is close by as well so the whole city is accessible from one location. Breakfast buffet had a great selection of hot and cold foods. Only downside was the restaurant menu at night. Not much to choose from and was expensive for what you got, however not much of a problem as there is plently of places close by. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronald F
Reviews.Content: Best shower I've ever had. Located right above Estacio sants, so very convenient or train or airport. Modern decor, but very nice rooms with good soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Highly underrated!”
Reviews.Author: dorius
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way better than described in lot of reviews. Maybe it's because it was recently renovated (old review should be deleted!). The location in very good for airport connections (15 min by train, right under the hotel) and to the city center it's also not far (about 15 min by metro). The hotel design is quite special and modern: our standard room had an open bathroom (with separate wc and shower), which makes the room feel bigger. The view from the 7th floor isn't bad either. Service and staff were friendly and helpful. For breakfast (until 10:30 am) there's a big buffet with a good variety of food. The only downsides (I noticed) are: some parts of the hotel still look old (the elevators), there was some dust under the bed and it could be a bit closer to the city center. I think this hotel has a great value and it's surely a good choice for Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, well positiond, easy acces to everything”
Reviews.Author: albertke28
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights, it was fantastic. Very clean, well maintained, modern rooms. Sizewise not too roomy but enough space if you don't travel with too many luggages. It's located above the train station though it's very quiet, great acces wherever you wanna go, metro lines, train station, bus station, easy ride from the airport straight to the hotel. We had great free wireless internet connection, big variety of meals for breakfast, very helpful staff, we certainly will come back again, the best place you can stay in Barcelona. The only thing can be improved is the lighting, bit dark during night time.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aldelfou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August 2010 for 4 days as we were beggining our honeymoon. Awfull and VERY RUDE reception (at night). They have rooms for smokers but all windows are WIDE SHUT! Not clean, poor variety for dinner. Since it's a hotel for business travelling (they explained this to us later on) the restaurant for dinner was closed during August! We also had to pay extra for the parking and each time that we wanted to get out from the parking lot we had to pass by the reception. Unfortunately we had to come back for one night before leaving for Greece -it was already paid for- and the answer of the receptionist was to choose another hotel since we don't like it!!! And on top of that he had the nerve to ask us who was the rude one since we made our complaints as paying customers! AWFULL, WE DON'T RECOMMEND IT, STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OldWandererAz
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Sants Hotel is located directly above the train station. Easy access to the airport and other locations in Spain and beyond. Cruise ship terminals are a short taxi ride away. Hop on/ Hop off tour bus stops right out front. Rooms are small, but very clean. Front desk personel are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, uniquely modern but sooooo noisy”
Reviews.Author: Paul4444_10
Reviews.Content: This is a large centrally located hotel convenient to airport, bus, train and metro and seems to be very popular with business travellers. Recently renovated the rooms have a 'space shuttle' theme that was fun. They are ultra modern, spotlessly clean and very comfortable - except that they are noisy. They have wooden floors and every noise in every room around you is accentuated. Also, at the lift area on each floor there are chairs and people congregate there at all hours talking loudly which echoes down the corridor. We did not sleep well despite a very comfortable bed. Management has obviously spent substantial sums in renovating the property and its a shame that (for us) is was not such a pleasant stay. We moved rooms once and staff were very cooperative and helpful in trying to find us a quite room. There are just so many positives for this property perhaps those who are less sensitive sleepers would have no concerns at all. Breakfast was included in the tariff ( a very reasonable one) and it was well presented, sufficient variety and satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Star Trek....”
Reviews.Author: historian63
Reviews.Content: That was actually a strange experience - on the pleasant side though. You cannot miss this piece of granite on top of the railway station Sants. Surrounded by some construction sites its not very appealing but the location beats it. Its just a stroll away from Rambla, the yacht harbor and the exhibition center with their shopping mall (converted from an old arena) next to it. The hotel itself leaves a quite standard impression from the outside and even the lobby is not too outside of the box. A carpet - which you probably would see in many other 90s built hotels - with chairs from a 70s space movie on it is already a bit edgy. But once you enter the lift (and leave it on your floor) you know that you are in a very different hotel. decorated like a journey to different planets, also inside the rooms, is certainly a VERY interesting experience. They even kept the story going with some welcome cards on the bed (lifting off from .... arriving on moon.... etc.). Pay attention to the wording on the bubbles hanging on the wall (bedroom and toilet). Did put a smile on my face. Unusual but very practicable: an open bathroom. It certainly did add space to the whole setup. Windows are huge (top to bottom is glass, no frames) with electric blinds coming from the ceiling and closing completely. Make sure you leave them closed if you have a room facing south. For some strange reason the air condition goes off once in a while and if you don't switch them on again it can become a bit sauna-style in the room. Wasn't only my problem. I saw a couple of other guests facing exactly the same issue. With some of them the AC didn't work at all. Not very pleasant when you come during summer time. Oh yes - you cannot open the window. Selection of TV channels is ok but with quite a dominance of Spanish channels. You get the impression that they uploaded every local Spanish channel they could find on the network. Selection of international channels is a bit limited. To say upfront - no pool.... I saw another hotel next to the exhibition center and the arena with a fantastic roof top swimming pool (if you are into swimming in Barcelona ... :-)) Internet (wireless) works very fast. Next morning breakfast was not opulent but absolutely sufficient. Nice bread and rolls, toast, cheese & ham (different kinds), yoghurt (you need to be fast to grab a plain one... otherwise you are left with the sugar infused options), cereal, coffee as much as you can absorb, juices (not fresh but not tooooo sweet as well)... enough to not leave hungry. Oh, one more point - parking. Before you consider to park somewhere in the narrow streets around Sants: forget that. Next morning your car is either towed or you will have to pay a hefty fine. Park on the nice sundeck of the hotel (there is a ramp leading to the upper platform where the hotel entrance is). benefit: you don't have to walk far to the car and its parked pretty safe. Downside: in the morning you will open the door to an oven... literally... the parking platform opens to the southwest and has full sunshine all day long. You do the math what happens in your car. Take out all CDs, otherwise you will have a couple of nice (expensive) coasters... Check out (as well as in) is fast, professional and a bit on the not-too-much-smiling-edge. Unfortunately. They could do better here.

Reviews.Title: “An Interestingly-themed Hotel we looked forward to coming back to every night”
Reviews.Author: Pearla T
Reviews.Content: To our initiial disappointment, the original hotel we wanted to stay in was full so we ended up at Barcelo Sants which turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. From the online reviews, we were not looking forward to Barcelo Sants at all (we were choosing between the other hotel and Barcelo Sants before our arrival) but from the moment we realized the hotel is right on top of the train station (upper floor of the same complex!) we thought to ourselves that at least it is convenient. However, as we enter the lobby, it became apparent that the hotel was not only convnient but was nicely designed with elegant interior but without the pretentious 5-star decor. The reception staffs were fast and efficient and they offer free internet inside the rooms. At this point, we were very happy and anything else beyond this would be a bonus. And quite a few bonuses there was: the walk to our room had the 'space shuttle' theme which was pretty interesting as a few guests from neighboring rooms took picture of. The room has separate shower and bathroom, big spacious bed, and a great view. During the day when we were out, we looked forward to coming back to our room and a happy thought it was as the hotel is, as said.. right on top of the train station. It fit very well into our busy schedule and saves us a lot of time for other important sightseeings.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish renovated hotel at sants”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Koeln
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two sides. The newly done rooms in floor 5 upwards are really nice and modern. Following a spaceshuttle storyline. Very chique. The lower floors are a trip back to the 80's with all the dust since then. But not sure whether these are in the selling anymore. Floor 4 was redone during our visit. Breakfast is ok. Friendliness of the people could be improved. The entry to the hotel at night ia via stairs to a car park...

Reviews.Title: “to be in the space....”
Reviews.Author: dtshura
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel, even though it doesn't look so from the outside. The lobby is old style, yet the rooms are just fantastic, ultra modern and practical. Not uncomfortable high-tech. The area is quite after midnight. Go to the city center. Taxi easily found and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “renovated, clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: texasconqueror
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Hotel Sants for five nights at our Barcelona trip. The hotel is totally renovated, rooms are very clean and modern. The location is a plus, it is just on the Sants metro station which is one of the main hubs in Barcelona... Overall, Hotel Sants was a very good choice for us

Reviews.Title: “the orbital room is great”
Reviews.Author: angeramos
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 orbital rooms at Barcelo Sants before our mediterranean cruise last May and truly the rooms were fanstastic, My grandchildren had a blast . the all white interior and the space ship look really caught their imagination...the bed was really big ...but there's one suggestion I would like to make.. maybe the bathroom and the toilet's glass doors should be tinted or darkened.. it's not comfortable using them when you know there's another person outside..it's ok if your husband and wife. though.. I have stayed at Barcelo Sants twice in the past because of the very convenient location ..just atop the main train station where you can get the metro,bus and taxi anytime ..now there's another reason to stay there the next time I go to Barcelona.. the beautiful orbital room ..I hope they maintain them well because it will be a waste .. the old room where I stayed 2 years ago was quite old and smelled bad ....

Reviews.Title: “best location for logistics with trainstation just underneath”
Reviews.Author: fly_rainman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my Family. Can recommand it very much, since it is located very ideal. 15 minutes by train directly form the Airport and at the Metrostation with three connections to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: C-Stop
Reviews.Content: The "orbital" rooms at this hotel are complete renovations with modern/trendy hallways, rooms and bathrooms. I estimate they were renovated within the past 6 months - super comfy beds, ~40" HD flat screen with about 5 English speaking (news and business) channels. floor to ceiling glass wall with exceptional views (our view was towards Sangrada Familia), black out window shades, great temperature controls. You're atop Barcelona's main train station (no train noise) for the Metro, regional trains (Renfe trains, which brings you to/from Terminal 2 at the airport in about 20 minutes), as well as those trains bound for Madrid, Paris, etc. You're about a 10 minute Metro ride to Las Ramblas via the L3 (green) line and 10 minute Metro ride to Sagrada Familia via the L5 (blue) line. We chose this hotel based upon (transportation) convenience and, more importantly, being the only Barcelona hotel in my price range ($200 or less/night - we spent $145/night at this hotel May 23-20) that verifiably had updated rooms. I read reviews for hours that repeatedly described outdated and "tired" rooms. I began to conclude that most of the hotels in Barcelona have undergone no updating since the 1992 Olympics. I was in the train station and surrounding area as late as midnight and there were absolutely no threats. Free internet that works and is decent speed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: kos_kal
Reviews.Content: Needs to clean better the room. The third bed was not so comfortable !

Reviews.Title: “good location, good hotel, could do a lot worse!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_B2010
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay, Sat. to Thursday, generally a good hotel. Good location for the aiport - direct train; and for getting around, above the Metro terminus. It's the centre of a busy road network which you have to negotiate to get anywhere on foot, so don't expect a quirky old Catalonian style of building - it's a medium sized modern tower...they describe themselves as the 'hotel in the clouds'. Apparently we were upgraded to an executive room, which was designed as a (space) pod, so quite open plan and modern, i.e. wash area in the main room! Great shower, WC is a little public...sliding door, no lock no extract no sound insulation! If you know your partner well you should have no real complaints - double king size bed a bonus. Breakie is typical European and adequate. One minor irritation - the blurb said 'Welcome tray' with tea & coffee making facilities. This didn't exist. When questioned about its whereabouts, was told they didn't do kettles anymore but we could order hot water from room servce...so having left our travel kettle at home on this basis, but brought tea bags, our first purchase was a small kettle & some milk (incidentally milk is UHT & sold in 1lt and 1.5lt cartons only). I need my brew when I'm traveling - have never found anywhere that knows how to make a proper cup of tea! Also means you can return to the hotel for a break later in the day before heading out again. Bit put out when we needed some more milk on the last day and asked at the bar, only to be charged €2.50 for a glass of milk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for City and Airport”
Reviews.Author: Cjibbo
Reviews.Content: A large yet quiet hotel situation in a great location above Barcelona's central station. Room where spacious and very comfortable, despite some sleazy art work and slightly dated decor. Breakfast was adequate and staff friendly so I would defiantly consider staying here again due to the great location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for transport links”
Reviews.Author: lacost69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at the Barcelo Sants in Feb 2011. We hardly spent any time in the hotel due to being out sightseeing all day and night! The hotels main attribute is its transport links. It is above Sants station. This is a 20 min train ride from the airport. Very easy to get to. Get on the train at the airport, off the train at the station and in the lift to the hotel reception...easy as! The room was nice, nothing flash. Lots of complimentary toiletries. Safe, mini bar is provided. Very comfy beds with plenty of pillows. Towels changed daily. Tv with some UK channels. We stayed on a room only basis so cannot comment on the food. The hotel bar was closed during our stay. Transport links are excellent. As I mentioned above, the train is on the doorstep plus the hotel screens all the up and coming departures and platforms which was excellent for us. The Metro was again under the hotel, perfect for zipping around Barcelona. Buses and taxis are a plenty outside the station too. Their are some bars and cafes local to the hotel and are reasonably priced. In the station itself theirs a McDonalds, cafes, shops, newsagents etc. This hotel is perfect for transport links. It is a little way out of the centre but only a few mins by Metro.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CONNECTIVITY...GREAT LOACATION....”
Reviews.Author: kashyapsagar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very decent hotel for the frequent business traveller as it is located right above the stacio sants or the sants station which connects you to most part of barcelona and also has acess to a food court and a taxi stand and the bus stops... very easily accessible from every part of the city and just a 25 minute drive from the airport. the staff here is extremely co-operative and speak comprehendable and gramatically correct english which could be a problem in other parts of the city. so it becomes very easy to communicate with the staff....also very close to the olympic stadium and the FC Barcelona stadium which is one of the major attractions of barcelona. the rooms are spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: nonoireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four night at the end of August. The rooms were good, and cleaned every day to a high standard. The staff were nice. The lift to get up to the hotel was small and sometimes took ages to come and it closed at midnight in which case you'd have to walk up a flight of outdoor stairs, not great late at night and in the heat!! What was great about this hotel was the location. Our bus from the airport dropped us straight across the road and you are on top of the train and tube station so anywhere is accessible from here. Some lovely cafes, shops and resturants in the little streets surrounding it which definately deserve a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: angeltobe
Reviews.Content: Following reading the other reviews I was concerned about the Barcelo Sants. I found the hotel to be great - the staff were friendly and willing to accomodate requests such as early check in. The rooms were spacious and very clean, the lobby area was impressive and the facilities in the hotel were of good standard. The location of the hotel was great for accessing metro and trains as well as being on the red route of the hop on hop off tour bus. The only down side of the hotel was the entrance at night when the street easy access was closed - to get to the front of the hotel meant climbing lots of steps and walking through a deserted car park. However, I would recommend the hotel and return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kiwicouple2007
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel as a top secret hotel from an online website for 2 nights in August 2010, although we still paid quite a lot comarative to other hotels. It was supposedly 4 Star but I dont think it was. No one helped us with our huge bags we were given a room which was actually quite nice however the noises in the night were ridiculous, we were awoken several times each night by banging and pipes clanging and the fridge buzzing at hourly intervals. However it is on top of the sants station so that was convenient which is what we were after

Reviews.Title: “standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: monamurray
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days with my hubby, the location of this hotel is very convient for trains, taxis,airport and opentop bus tours.. I found hotel to be basic for a 4* there was no tea makin facilites which i was dissappointed with.. Rooms were clean and tidy and cleaned every day..the staff were ok but not very plesant and made no effort to interact with guests...we found the hotel quiet with very little english speakin guests and staff there..we were told the restaurant was closed while we were there but there was a snack menu in bar which we used once which was pretty tasty... Food choices in the hotel and the area were not up to much we ate in restaurant across from hotel on the 1st day, my hubby got a burger which was raw in the middle, needless to say we did not eat there again...so we ended up having few mc donalds during our stay... All in all we had a great time in barcelona, but dont think i would use this hotel again, i think the staff could do with being more friendly and helpful to guests...Maybe its just me but i also found a lot of the locals were very abrupt and unplesant people.. On the plus side the little girl who sits in the bus turistic ticket box was the most plesant and helpful person we met in Barcelona...The open top bus is great way of getting round the city...

Reviews.Title: “Not Customer Focussed”
Reviews.Author: bilbelseb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early July on a four-day trip to Barcelona. I chose it because of the convenience of taking public transport, both from the airport and once in Barcelona. That was all as expected (metro was extremely convenient and easy to use, taxis right on the doorstep, rooms quiet, breakfast buffet not bad), but the negatives very much outweighed the positives. We started out in a family suite with air conditioning that did not work. The hotel knew the rooms were hot because when we asked to move perhaps to another similar "suite", they said all the family rooms were uncomfortably hot. They were also not proper beds for the kids. If all the family rooms are hot, why not tell us that in the beginning instead of forcing us to request a move to another two rooms? They did slightly discount the cost of the two rooms, but I would have rather started in a cool room. They then informed us about the breakfast buffet and told us a price 50% greater than what they had confirmed by email and the same 50% above the prices they were advertising in their lifts! When I pointed that out, the reception wanted to argue with me about it. When we actually went to the breakfast the bill they wanted me to sign also had the higher price. It sorted itself when we checked out, but only because I refused to pay the higher price. Again, if I hadn't raised the issue they would have happily charged me more. I think the hotel is a good bit less expensive than hotels in town, but be warned that if you want to eat out or even get takeaway you will need to walk at least 20 minutes, take the metro or a taxi. There are plenty of taxis there, but if you are too tired to go out one night you have little choice but McDonalds in the train station. If the location suits you then perhaps consider the Torre Catalunya, which is only about 100m away and I seem to recall rates pretty high with Tripadvisor travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Has good number of disadvantages, think twice”
Reviews.Author: Shekamu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelo Sants for three nights with my spouse and a small baby. We booked this hotel as my husband attended a conference in the same hotel. Our first impression on seeing the room was that it was very old and depressing. I guess coming from Dubai, we expect European hotels to be a bit dated but this hotel is in desperate need of refurbishment, at least of the carpets. The taps in the bathrooms are a bit stiff when opening and closing and you have to adjust the hot and cold taps (they don't have one tap for both). The shower had bursts of very hot water for no reason which made me afraid of sudden changes in temperature. The bed was very big, and the bathroom had a hairdryer and toothbrush kit, but there was no kettle, and when I asked for boiled water to make baby's milk I was told I should come down to the service floor myself to pick it up or else pay a EUR 3 charge. I said I'd pay the charge anyway, but then they didn't charge me as it was for the baby (only nice thing from service). There is no iron in the room and although they said they provide an iron on request, I was told it's for free only after 5 pm and I have to use their laundry service if I wanted to iron in the morning. The cost for ironing a blouse is EUR 9. On Sundays, they charge double for the ironing (EUR 18). I've never stayed in even a 3 star hotel that doesn't provide irons! I ended up hanging a shirt in the bathroom to get the shower steam to straighten it. They said that they have free Wi-Fi but there was no signal in the rooms. I could only get a connection standing halfway outside the room door in the corridor. You have to pay to use the computers at the business centre. The lifts that take you to the station from the hotel are ridiculously small and dirty. Very claustrophobic.The location is good if you plan on using the metro/trains, but for our type of trip with a baby stroller etc, we preferred taxis and you can get those easily at the station just below the hotel, but it would've been more suitable for us to move to a hotel located in the main shopping boulevard instead of paying taxi fare (varies between EUR 7 - 15), and we did move the last night to the much better Majestic Hotel on Passeig de Gracia. Not only was it very similar in price, but it is rated as 5 star, we were welcomed by a smiling doorman everytime (Barcelo don't open doors for you), got a much more spacious room, far nicer bathrooms and their bellboy carried our heavy suitcases all the way to the door of our train at the nearby train station! They gave us a baby bottle warmer with a cot with bumpers and all. Huge difference! Barcelo Sants may have been a 4 star when it opened, but at the moment I'd say it's a 3 star bordering on 2.5. They are lacking in their facilities, service and interior quality and have outrageous money-squeezing tactics. You can stay at better quality hotels with far better service for around the same price in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eilis186609
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, quiet and so convenient for sight seeing also for train to airport and metro. With hotel situated over train station what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very spacious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: pinkblonde00
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect area of Barcelona for sightseeing without having to take a taxi or bus. The employees at the front desk were a little stuffy and kept us waiting a while when no other clients were present at the desk. But the rooms were very nice; more than enough room to stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, exactly on the transport centre.”
Reviews.Author: luthfa
Reviews.Content: The staffs were OK, very normal staff. But the location of the hotel impressed me much. We can reach any corner of the tourist attraction of Barcelona from the hotel. Any destination you have, just use the lift in the lobby and you'll find yourself right down in the Metro and Railway Station. That's incredible! Not only, but you could find many mini markets, many fast food restaurants and local souvenirs too..Everything is there, below this hotel. Not only tourist attraction I could reach by subways from here, but I went to other city (Valencia) by using the train and came back late at night without fear because when I get down from the train I was back exactly below my hotel! The one thing I'm sorry for this hotel was that old hairdryer was still used in the bathroom. But the bathroom was clean and fine, built in white marble. The hotel gave us toothbrush too, and that's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the station”
Reviews.Author: timpaws
Reviews.Content: With easy connections to the airport via the main station immediately underneath the hotel, Barcelo Sants is in an ideal location if you're flying in and out on a tight timeframe. The entrance from the station makes you feel like you're going to be staying at a hostel rather than a hotel, as one of two (very slow) and ridiculously small lifts rattles you up to the main reception foyer. I was staying free of charge (my partner attending a international conference at the hotel) so it was excellent value for money for me! Compared with other hotels in the Barcelo fleet, Sants was internally a little tired seeming in an 80's chic kinda way, though contrary to other reviewers we found the front desk service very efficient and our room and bathroom were clean and appropriately serviced daily. Meals at the hotel were very good - according to my partner - but we ate out in the evenings, with a wide range of very good eateries within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Mathezar
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Barcelo Sants was excellent. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful, everyone at the front desk spoke excellent English. The room was spacious and clean. And the breakfast buffet was very nice. We traveled with two younger kids and the hotel placed two rollaway beds in the lounge part of the suit for them. The hotel is literally directly above the Bacelona Sants train station, but the room was quiet and comfortable. I read a review of another family that were less than impressed. We had the family suite which probably isn't what they had. So if you have a family you will probably want to ask specifically for the family suite.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent base for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Corbetts23
Reviews.Content: Good choice of hotel for visiting Barcelona, it is above Barcelo Sants main rail station so easily accessible from the airport by rail. It is also great for the metro system, directly underneath the hotel and station and also the tourist bus stop is outside the station together with the taxi rank. The hotel itself is good standard, rooms cleaned daily and very spacious and clean, the only down side is the smoke smell in the corridor, but thankfully did not affect the room. Never had a meal or buffet breakfast but there are several cafes and a macdonalds in the station below which offer a variety of food at a good price. In Barcelona centre (approx 6 metro stops to catalunya) I can recommend two restaurants La Fontan and also La Botiga (both in a side street towards the end of Las Ramblas/gothic side) food is excellent in both and really well priced, approx 40 euros for two people including wine, water and three courses and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, inconsistent brand”
Reviews.Author: charliejones1966
Reviews.Content: barcelo hotels are a strange mixture and there is no consistency with the brand which does make you question what the brand represents. their hotels in barcelona are a good example because the raval is fab and the sants is average. more of a business travellers hotel. great location for access - being above the main bus/rail terminus - but full of conferences and lacking in intimacy. many other hotels in barca ahead of it but not bad if it's all you can find.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: BrunoDuque
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel, was for 4 days, only to sleep because during the days we were visiting de city. Good value between price/location/ .

Reviews.Title: “Well worn, faded and in need of upgrading”
Reviews.Author: dougfromalberta
Reviews.Content: Other than location(on top of the train station and a 20 minute walk from La Ramblas and the port), this hotel has little to offer. Inattentive staff (typical in a "transit hotel'), smoking rooms (complete with cigarette burns) coverted to non smoking rooms), bathroom drains badly plugged (both sink and bath) bedspreads thread bare, carpets worse. Rooms are a decent size but, all in all, a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: sean9
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights in november. Good value - much cheaper than anything near la ramlas. Acoomodation reasonable and do not agree with comments about poor standards. Everything accessible by metro and on foot (if you are energetic) Good breakfast and complementary wifi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jillmitt
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Sants is quite a luxurious hotel on top of the main railway station but there was no noise and very welcoming staff. The road to the back of the hotel had lots of pavement cafes and restaurants which were so much cheaper than if you stayed nearer Las Ramblas. We paid 15 euros for 2 excellent meals and a bottle of wine. The restaurants were full of locals so you knew they were good places to eat. Being on top of the station meant you could catch the metro wherever you wanted to go for about 50p per journey. A real gem of a find

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: We were arriving in Barcelona by rail and booked the Sants hotel because it is directly above the railway station. Easy access, and a swift check in. Room was clean, very dated and so much wood, with little purpose other than decoration, and that failed dismally. Busy hotel though and large reception and bar lounges. Breakfast buffet was 2 fo €10 and a bargain. The Red bus runs from outside the station and it´s a good way of passing 2 hours doing the sights of Barcelona in comfort - still warm there at 20c for October it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: atk1031
Reviews.Content: This was a last-minute reservation, and turned out to be just right. Due to a medical emergency, my original 5 nights in Barcelona were reduced to one night. As I was taking the train to Granada the next day, I needed a place near the Sants train station. You can't get any closer than the Barcelo Sants. The breakfast is excellent, and you can get food in the bar all day, a plus for me with my limited schedule. In addition, I was worried that my medical problem had resurfaced, and an incredibly helpful woman at reception found me an (almost) English-speaking doctor at short notice. The single room was also larger than the ones I later occupied in Granada and Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is filthy...”
Reviews.Author: BoxwoodAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: The carpets are filthy. The furniture is filthy. The cabinets are chipped, the molding is falling off. The staff was unhelpful and sometimes wrong. My computer acquired many viruses. The beds are like rocks. The water was often too hot with no cold. The bathtub didnt drain. The toilets ran. There was no ice. The soda machine was out of order. No concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: JinaChicago
Reviews.Content: Company placed us in this hotel for cardiology congress. You can not avoid the feeling of dirtiness, water in the bathroom was either very hot or no water at all. Carpets dirty. Staff not helpfull. Breacfast limited. Select another hotel, that's my honest advise. Despite that's they claim that the windows were soundproof you could not sleep becuase of the music downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: davefromedmonton
Reviews.Content: A fantastic value! And a great place to stay while exploring Barcelona! When I read some of the other reviews, I was a bit tentative, since we have stayed in a number of places that have been disappointing in Europe this trip, but the price was right. We ended up paying 100 euro/night for two nights and had free wireless internet, a safe, a fantastic breakfast for two and a late checkout for 3pm (all of which is not normally included at the base rate and all of which we used -- the late checkout was perfect for us.) If you want to just hang out at the beach, I wouldn't stay here though. It is a great hub for touring the city, but not going to the beach. We bought a two day pass on the Bus Turistica (27 euro p/p) and used this for our primary means of transportation around the city, while taking in many of the sites. Because there is a stop right outside the hotel (and main train station), it was very convenient. We had to ride the same routes a couple of times to get back to our hotel, but that was fine as it gave us a repeat of the great information provided on this bus. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. Above and beyond the tourist hop-on/hop-off bus (which is 1000 times better than the ones in Rome), the hotel is located right on top of the Metro subway system and the main train station. If you are traveling by train, don't bother going anywhere else. We had prebooked another hotel for our last night in Barcelona and it was also fairly close to the train station, but it was a 5 star and completely over-priced with little value to the money spent. I will write a review about them, too, as I wasn't impressed with the Melia Barcelona. The little things are important in this hotel. The abundance of toiletries provided, the fantastic breakfast, etc. Some things that may irritate you though are: The front desk seems to have an attitude problem. The guy who checked us in from Venezuela was great -- he gave us a map and some suggestions while being friendly and helpful. The rest of the crew behind that desk, seemed to hate people. Fortunately, once you're checked in, there should be little interaction with them. The other thing that may irritate is the fact that the non-smoking floors smell like smoke. I read that in another review, although it is tolerable and we are very sensitive to that sort of thing. We noticed it, but it wasn't a big deal. At 100 euros, you can't expect much in Europe, so this turned out to be the best value for the money in over 7 cities that we visited this trip. By far, the best value. If you're there to tour the city and maybe do any day trips outside of the city, definitely try to stay here. It is worth it at those kinds of rates.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for the train station”
Reviews.Author: INDEPENDANTTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel purely because we were arriving too late in the day for onward travel to our holiday resort. We had previously stayed there on a weekend break, which isn't ideal as there is not a great deal in the area. however on this occasion we were simply getting on the train in the morning to travel on to a resort by train. For this purpose, this hotel is excellently located. We arrived late in the evening. The man on reception was extremely polite and helpful. the reception area and bar etc are lovely and cool and spacious. We did not use any of the facilities so I cannot comment. The room was really nice with a good view of the city. We were asked if we wanted a double bed or two singles and it was nice to find a proper superking size bed and not two singles pushed together, which in many hotels, passes for a double bed. Plenty of storage space and a tv and mini bar. Not sure of the prices as we didnt use the minibar. The bathroom was a decent size and some toiletries were provided. We paid just under £80 through travel republic. At first I thought this was a lot for the purpose of our stay and looked for somewhere cheaper. cheaper accommodation would have probably meant a taxi ride etc and an even later arrival time so we didn't bother. I would definitely do the same again. We could have flown on an early morning flight but that would have meant getting up at 3am and still getting to the resort at the same time. the evening flight was cheaper so the overall journey cost us the same and we had a lovely night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as previous reviews!”
Reviews.Author: zimheidi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via lastminute.com through their Top Secret Hotels method so I only found out what the hotel was once I had booked and paid for it. On looking at the reviews I was horrified and seriously thought about changing hotels based on the reviews but could not find anything as cheap as this hotel so I decided to stick with it and hope for the best. Well, I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting a real dive but do you know what, it was not that bad at all, in fact we found everything to be more than adequate and satisfactory. Yes I agree, the hotel needs refurb and looks a bit tired but it is nowhere near as bad as some of your previous reviews. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast is fabulous and their offer of upgrading for 20Euro per double room per night which includes free breakfast, free wifi, free use of the safe is a bargain. I have to say I was more annoyed that anything when I arrived at the hotel because due to the reviews on here I suffered unneccassary anxiety when there really was no need for it because the hotel is fine!!! The location is perfect being on top of one of the main train stations and really really easy to get to from the airport via train. So in short, this hotel is absolutely fine although a bit tired and lets be honest, do you go to Barcelona to sit in a hotel room all day???

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Hidden costs.”
Reviews.Author: Garer
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpets. Hiddencosts - reception doesn't t tell - e.g. € 4.50 per day for using a very small safety box in your room. Bekfast: slices of cheese and sausage on plates dry and tasteless.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, although location is convenient”
Reviews.Author: LMIKEK
Reviews.Content: Found on Booking and value looked good (150 Eur for 2 nights for a 4 star hotel). Problems are: - poor service at arrival: no one helps with your bags, not the usual service for a 4 star hotel. - the old carpets are so full of dirt you get annoided before arrive to your room; - the room has clear signs that was poorly clear and with little care: one top of the minimar there was a strange dirty material (old cofee?). The curtains were placed without being properly ironed. We prefer simple hotels but well cleaned. Unfortunatelly this is not the case! Please change the manager, and clean the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for train station. Short cab ride to Las Ramblas (or easy metro ride)”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: Quite an old hotel and the executive rooms were not very executive. Really good breakfast though and nice buffet for lunch and dinner. If you have an executive room it includes free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Will have left if the payment was not settled”
Reviews.Author: Lung888
Reviews.Content: High speed of free wifi provision. Convenient location but very expensive for my 5-night stay in late June to early July. Dirty..a dead fly stick at the room window throughout my stay. The dirty glass cup remain (probably left by the previous users) was not replaced througout my stay. Old style carpet; and slightly uncomfortable smell inside the room once I step-in even it is a non smoking room. Luckily, the reception services is still acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: smiley2703
Reviews.Content: Located right above the main tube stop in Barcelona, this hotel makes it very convenient to get everywhere! A little on the pricey side, I would suggest booking through hotels.com for a cheaper rate. Do add breakfast to your stay, they have a great spread! Easy to walk many places...and if you enjoy walking it's an easy walk down to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Life”
Reviews.Author: jltiwari
Reviews.Content: We wanted a romantic getaway from the hussle and bussle of the city noise and crowd and thought of barcelona ;)....Booked barcelona sants through hotel.com and without question this was our best stay till date. right from their customer service on the desk to their food to the overall cleanliness(which is always on the top for me) they rank A+. THough the chef struggle in english still helped us with vegan food to their best. Awesome trip and an equally awesome hospitality. Would recommend to anyone planning for barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “4 star for 3 people?! - Ha! Read on for the real joke!”
Reviews.Author: CaTravelinFolks
Reviews.Content: Found through hotwire.com. We stayed at several hotels throughout Spain, and when we ask for a 3 person room, we don't expect a wheel-in bed crammed into an already extremely small room!! Two double beds would have been great, but no, they had 2 single beds and a roll-away. I don't think so! We didn't even have room to open our luggage! Everyone's comments about the dreary state of the rooms are spot-on. The bathroom door looked like it was painted with mildew, the beds were painful, Wi-fi was spotty at best, and the parking was very expensive. So anyway, I grab our key and go upstairs to get a sandwich for my daughter and I - that was cool they were open until 1 in the morning. 6.5 euros for a tuna sandwich the cheapest item, I try to remember our room number so I can charge it to our room. The guy tries all these numbers and I'm seeing everyone's names in all these rooms -- "no that's not me". So, I pay cash. I knew where the room was from the elevator. I put the key in it seems to fit but the bolt is locked. I call my wife and some man answers groggily. "Oh sorry, wrong room!" It must be the room next door... I try the key, and it fits and opens. The lights are already off? "Honey?" I turn on the lights, and a young lady I don't know sits up in her bed staring at me in obvious fright! "Whoa! Sorry! Wrong room!!" I rushed off for the elevator. How did that happen?! Perhaps these stupid plastic keys can open multiple rooms in the hotel?? I was dumb founded! Needless to say, I was going to have a word with the front desk! "This key seems to open more than just our room...." "My master key!!" This poor excuse for a hotel clerk was obviously overwhelmed when we came in at midnight. He was alone at the front desk and there was no one to help with luggage. He knew we weren't going to be happy about our room and he wasn't even sure he had a roll-away available. He was generally nervous and rushed up with us to the room to check on this extra bed. In the process, he accidentally left his master key with us. Who knows how often this happens, but this time I was just unlucky enough to leave my room forgetting which floor our room was on. In the morning, after a overpriced and unsavorable breakfast, we spend our morning until checkout searching the Internet for our next night's stay. Thanks to Tripadvisor.com, we found U232 and tonight we're staying a very comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Barcelona's pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: PW24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient, being built over the main rail station and subway interchange. It's clean, quiet and functional. It is well overdue for a complete refurb, tired decor, worn fittings, grotty carpets, etc. Rooms have a safe, a vital item in Barcelona, but the hotel charge extra for it.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good deal”
Reviews.Author: JanWill
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have commented, the rooms are shabby and in need of renovation, the bathroom lacks ventilation, and the bed is hard -- it's really NOT a 4* hote! But, it is still a good deal for what you get -- a handly location on top of the train/metro station with acess to taxis and a McDonald's (great for cheap food at any hour). We had a 7th floor room with a nice view of the city, an our "weekend rate" included their wonderful buffet breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lotticb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Barcelo Sants Hotel for one night having spent a few days with one group of friends and about to meet the next group. I decided that I would book a central hotel and treat myself to a 4 star stay (as it was categorised on the website I booked through) since I would be alone. On arriving late, I was looking forward to a relaxing bath, fluffy pillows, fresh linen and a good film, but... The room was grubby and in desperate need of renovation - the skirting board was broken, the decor very out of date, the bed linen had seen better days, the basin was cracked and the shower/bath tiles were mouldy. I had requested a non smoking room, but the windows cannot be opened and the air con seems to circulate air from all over the hotel, meaning that my room had very stale slightly smokey air. After 40 mins in the room I had to switch as it was so airless that I had started to feel ill. The next room was marginally better... The only positives were that the hotel is in a perfect location for coming from the airport or leaving the city by train.

Reviews.Title: “Good for travel, shabby - needs modernisation”
Reviews.Author: PudgyGal
Reviews.Content: Mainly business travellers in this hotel Upside: Great location - this is above their Sant Estacio Train & Metro station. A great base to get to most places. Direct train from airport to the station will only cost you EUR2.60. (You can get to Le Rambla in about 10 mins. Recommend you buy the T10 Metro ticket which is EUR7.20 for 10 metro trips, 1 zone, multiperson use.) Below in the station are shops which is convenient, incl chemist, Mcdonalds, cafes etc Downsides: Rather shabby and very small rooms, that need updating. No ventilation in the bathrooms for instance. Breakfast is EUR15 per day for a buffet. Expect to be charged for everything, that you would expect as standard in a 4 star hotel in the UK for instance. Eg, Use of the safe EUR4.50/day. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room (very basic), I requested a kettle in the room (I always drink green tea) and they tried to charge EUR9.63 a day for this. If the inflated price is not an issue, the kettle was in a disgusting condition (plastic inside was flaking around and the limescale on the element was so bad, that you could see it floating in the water. Thought this was extremely poor). Room service cant speak English very well, it took 3 attempts to get the kettle. WiFi EUR6.50/hour in designated areas. Thinnest walls I have ever encountered in a hotel - you can hear people in the next room speaking, flushing toilet, opening doors or anything. Other points worth noting: Right opposite the Expo Hotel and the Torres - so those hotels are equally convenient in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “carefree and happy”
Reviews.Author: Grumpyoleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sants for four days at the beginning of August 2008.The location of the Sants is excellent, close to the tourist bus terminals and all of the other attractions. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and extremely helpful. The food was excellent and reasonably priced,huge breakfast buffet for 9 euros,possibly the largest we have ever seen. The rooms were better than expected,after reading other reviews,with clean linen every day,We had no problems with the air conditioning. All in all we had a wonderful time in Barcelona and the hotel was a major part in it. We would highly recommed it.t

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Nevertravelweary
Reviews.Content: As most other reviewers observed, this hotel is very conveniently located. Barcelona has an awesome metro rail system over which the Barcelo Hotel Sants is located. Hence, you can get to the Airport, the beaches, La Rambla, Sagrada Familia, Montjuic, The Barcelona Aquarium and just about anywhere else you wish to visit in the City without any hassle at all. It's a great thing for two reasons. First, you will want to spend as much time away from the hotel property as possible. Second, the hotel charges a whopping 24.00 euros per night for parking. This is not a place to chill. Our room was very disappointing other than the surcharge-free wireless internet access. The mattresses were deplorably thin and hard. Moreover, while the bathroom was cleaned each day during our 10-day stay, the mildew remained. Additionally, there were pieces of hardware missing from the shower fixtures.
