Likewise, although we met guests from the U.K., Scotland and Ireland while there, the only television channels broadcasting in English were news stations. Hence, we endeavored to exhaust ourselves before returning to our room at night so that we could go straight to sleep and rise early to go out for the day. Finally, the one meal we ate in the hotel's restaurant other than breakfast as well as the breakfast buffet that we had three (3) times or so were extremely over-priced. The staff was pleasant but not pleasant enough to inspire us to return or recommend the Barcelo Sants to others.

Reviews.Title: “A decent base for the city”
Reviews.Author: steelydom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend recently for a week and in general it is a a very decent hotel. Yes, it isn't the newest built hotel in barcelona but everything is there that you need. Its big point is of course it sits on top of the metro which is great for cross city jaunts or getting to-and-from airports. A word of warning though, the metro finishes at midnight during the summer (earlier in the winter) and since you don't really eat dinner in Spain till 9-10, you will probably find yourself hailing a taxi/bus to get home - its a bit of a walk unless your near the new city area - slightly inconvenient. Staff are friendly and helpful. You can do a lot lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate But Shabby Rooms Atop Central Transit Hub”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with my daughter here in late July. Overall, the place was OK, but only because I was able to book it at a very favorable price. The good thing about the hotel is that it sits atop the central train station. It is therefore a direct 20-minute train ride from the airport and on two Metro lines. This makes it a convenient hop or two to wherever you want to go along Barcelona's extensive and well-serviced Metro lines. The double-decker tourist buses also stop right outside, and there is a reasonable assortment of eating establishments in the area. Placa D'Espanya at the base of Montjuic is two stops or a 15-20 minute walk away. The smallish room was disapointing. It had a depressing, faded green decor. The mattresses on the twin beds were hard, thin and fairly uncomfortable. The bathroom was cramped. The tub had cracked tile, mildew and an extremely slow drain. If you wanted to use the in-room safe, they charged 4 EUR per night to activate it. On the plus side, wireless internet was free if you had your own computer with you. The common areas of the hotel were somewhat nice. Unfortunately, the common areas are not where you sleep and bathe. There was a basic fitness center and a business center. The hotel's other saving grace was its staff, who were uniformly friendly and helpful. As well, they were conversant in English, which is a big help if you don't speak Catalan or Spanish. If they would take the trouble to renovate their rooms, this hotel could be all right. For now, though, it rates 2 stars on my scale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonflick
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was pretty nice, right by the train station so easy access to everywhere. The beds were the only part I was not to happy about, but everyone was more than happy to help out with any problem I was having. The food at the hotel was pretty good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Travel Links”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_J_and_L
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for the weekend of 18 - 20th July 2008 as part of a package to see Bruce Springsteen at Nou Camp so this hotel wasn't one we actually chose BUT we were pleasantly surprised. As stated, the hotel is directly about the Central Train station with Metro links but as all the tracks are underground, you wouldn't have known it ..... we couldn't/didn't hear a thing. We got the train from the Airport (5 euros each) into the station, walked outside, up a short walkway, into the lift which took us straight into the Hotel reception. From the outside, this hotel looks like an office block but inside is modern, relaxing and clean. Check in was quick, efficient and easy - the reception staff are lovely, very helpful and charming. Room was OK - nothing special but clean, the aircon was very efficient (we had to turn it off at one point as we were too cold in 90+ degree heat!) and the bed comfortable. Power shower was great once we worked out how to switch it on! We didn't eat at the hotel except for breakfast which was very good. Good choice of fruit, juice, baked goods, cereal, meat, cheese and hot buffet. J doesn't eat meat but didn't struggle at all to find something he could eat. A previous reviewer said he felt rushed as the staff cleared his table whilst he was still eating but although the same happened to us (we were a group of 4), its just their way. Yes, dirty plates, cutlery and napkins were cleared when we were still at the table but in our case were replaced with clean cutlery and napkins straightaway. On our first morning, we lingered in the restaurant for about 50 minutes and didn't feel under any pressure to hurry up and leave. The only blip during our stay in this hotel was the Cocktail Bar. After Friday night out in Barcelona, we returned to the hotel around midnight and thought we would have a night cap. Deciding to be decadent, we all opted for a cocktail. However, the menu is in Spanish and some of the ingredients we just couldn't work out. The Bar guy was less than helpful - we asked for his recommendation and help in translating and he just glared at us and shrugged his shoulders. So we ordered hoping for the best, sat at a table and waited and waited and waited. He took 30 minutes to make 4 cocktails - a Tom Collins, Manhattan, Margarita and a non- alcoholic fruit cocktail. 3 were very pleasant but the Margarita was awful. There was way too much salt on the rim of the glass (I had to wipe it off) and instead of a teaspoon of castor sugar in the bottom of the glass, he put salt instead making it undrinkable. It was like drinking a glass of sea water. Did we complain? Well, no but in our defence he wasn't the most approachable of people, it was 12.45am and we were tired having been up for 18+ hours and quite frankly we couldn't be bothered - just put it down to experience. Check out on Sunday morning was quick and easy - having pre-paid for our trip and having no additions to our bill it took all of 30 seconds! Overall a pleasant stay. OK its not right in the centre of all the action but the transport links are so good - rail and metro under the hotel, taxi rank right outside and the open top tourist bus stop just across the road - its a fantastic location for getting in, out and around the City.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: DebHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days at the hotel for a conference. Based on some earlier reviews, I was expecting the worst, but was pleasantly surprised. As others have said, the location is good, being above the train station, you can pretty much anywhere in the city in 15-20 minutes. Our room was in good condition, clean and fairly well maintained. Unlike other visitors, our AC was super efficient and we ended up turning it off at night. The staff was helpful and the cleaning staff were efficient and accommodating. There are not a lot of extras, but the breakfast buffet is lavish, especially the baked goods. The lunch buffet is good but over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in the barcelo sants!”
Reviews.Author: amirag71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barcelo sants for 7 nights and traveled all over the city and even outside of bcn. The hotel is great , the staff was super friendly and helpfull(especially a girl named sara), they even let us stay for extra hours before our flight back home for 10 euros per hour (the 1st hour was for free)-i never got this chance in other hotels in europe and always had to pay for a full of 1/2 day. The station under the hotel is excellent for tourists,there is a barcelona turisme office there, a cafetria, mac donalds,shops etc. the barcelona busturistic has a stop right in front of the hotel so we didnt have to go far to use this service. The room was nice, the bed was big and comfy. The only downside was the noise you could hear from the room near us or from the corridor- its a bit embarassing and can make you think you share the room and bed with others, but we got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good mass transit connections”
Reviews.Author: scottsiegel1959
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. Somewhat outside tourist center, but right above train and subway station leading to quick connections on multiple lines. Restaurant has a good buffet breakfast and dinner was also good. Rooms are nice sized, but A?C is off in winter even if it''s warm. Rooms are good size and hotel gets Fox News!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ash108
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here and was impressed. The hotel is located directly over the main train/metro station so getting around is very easy. The train from the airport even stops here. Hotel itself is a modern business style hotel that while lacking in character it makes up in space. The lobby area is huge and has a bar and several eating areas including a fine dining restaurant. The rooms are spacious and clean and from our room on the 7th floor you had a great view out over the city. We ate in the hotel only twice once in the bar which was fine and once in the fine dining restaurant which was overly stuffy....they even served me a beer in a wine glass! All in its a fine hotel in a very convenient location for traveling around.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: gisgo
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Barcelo Sants in April. It was the first time, that we have been in Barcelona and the city is really wonderful. The hotel is well located and you can reach the metro within 5 minutes, therefore it is easy to reach all sight seeing hot spots. The room was clean, but you can see, that the hotel is already a few years old. The front desk staff was very helpful with restaurant recommandations and directions. We booked via expedia.com and got a very reasonable rate. The only thing we really disliked, is that there is no way to open the windows in the room, and the aircondition was not working very well.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pegct
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel one night prior to leaving on a Mediterranean cruise in May. The main reason I chose this hotel was the price factor as the maximum occupancy is three adults to a room in Barcelona and we had a total of four adults which required two rooms. The hotel is easily accessible from the airport as it is located directly above the Sants train which is approximately the fourth stop on the train from airport to Barcelona. Several of the previous reviews noted that the hotel was not located close to the main city attractions but we found it convenient to go downstairs and take the Metro a few stops(5-10 minutes) and navigate our way to the various tourist attractions. If we had more time we would have purchased a ticket for the Tourista Sightseeing Bus which had a stop located directly across the street from the hotel which allowed you to hop on and off at the various stops in the city. The main lobby was large but did not have a concierge desk so any questions we had we did have to wait at main reception desk to get answers to. The rooms were very clean, decor was somewhat outdated and beds very hard but I would stay here again based on room rates as compared to many other hotels located in the main tourist areas. (One tip I would advise is to leave one room card key in the electrical outlet grid to keep your airconditioning on while you are out of room as the rooms get very stuffy and hot and take quite a while to cool down if airconditioning is off during the day.)

Reviews.Title: “Back to the future”
Reviews.Author: Beez77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last night of our trip to Barcelona, in order to make a quick getaway to the airport the next morning. The proximity to the RENFE station is the main selling point, but the lobby is also promising. But as others have noted, the rooms leave a lot to be desired -- there's a distinct 1987 feel to them. The hair dryer might have been from 1977. But for what we needed, the place fit the bill ... and was worth the low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not too keen on the Sants”
Reviews.Author: Pixelated
Reviews.Content: I was staying on business, attending a conference at the Fira. From that perspective the location of the hotel is good - within an easy 10-15 minute of Placa Espanya - so no reliance on taxis or public transport. From the tourist's perspective the location isnt great as it isnt too near the majority of attractions. That said it is still pretty central and being right on top of Sants station makes for very easy access to the airport. In terms of decore the hotel is *very* tired, my room having seen much wear and tear. Beds are cheap and hard, not in a pleasantly firm way but with more of a "cheap mattress with few springs" vibe. My aircon worked, thought that of many of my fellow guests didnt, leading to perpetually freezing or baking rooms. There are many other hotels in Barcelona. I wouldnt recommend picking this one unless proximity to the Fira is your main criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Sants - not pants!”
Reviews.Author: SiThompson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel sight unseen, as it was via Lastminute.com's "Top Secret" hotel choice. This is where you get a heavily discounted rate for a 4* hotel, but don't find out where it is until you've booked. So when we'd booked it, we checked out the location, and found it was in the "Industrial" area, near the Sants RENFE train station. When we arrived at the station, we realised that the hotel is actually part of the station. Once you leave the station and enter the spacious lobby, the place starts to look 4*, with a very modern feel. We stayed in room 224, which is actually on the 3rd floor, offering a quite elevated view of the Sants square and surrounding buildings. The room was a double, quite big with TV, mini-bar and a shower and bath ensuite. Although the room had air-conditioning it was not very effective and the one window could not be opened. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, speaking excellent English, and happy to recommend bars and restaurants. Within a Kilometre there are several Tapas bars, cafes and restaurants, which work out cheaper than the hotel. and the station is a 5 minute train ride from the placa Catalunya, which is a good starting point to explore the city. Despite my initial impression, I would stay here again as the train access makes sightseeing easy, and the station offers the Barcelona card (universal travel ticket) from it's tourism booth. I would classify it as 3* and pricey, but overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Calboy54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sants in January and thought the location and price was wonderful. The staff were very helpful with most speaking english. The train took us right from the airport to the hotel and the metro connects you to the rest of the city right under the hotel. There is construction going on but we spent most of our time exploring the rest of the city. For the price it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stop with the four star - Your kidding me”
Reviews.Author: jokol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. I might as well stayed on the sidewalk outside of the hotel, thats how bad the beds are. Expedia should be ashamed of themselves advertising this hotel as a 4 star. I have stayed in Super 8's more comfortable than this place. The lobby gives you a very good feeling about the hotel. Then you get your key and take the somewhat dangerous ride up the 80 year old elevator. You get in the halls and it's like you landed on the set of the "Shining". I stayed at the Tryp Apolo hotel during the same trip to Barcelona. WAY BETTER and only rated a 3 1/2 star. I dont get it. The staff was not very friendly either, but I had come to expect that from most of the people in Europe when speaking to Americans. They don't seem to like us these days. Look around and pay the extra money to stay at another hotel. This one is definetely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside, convenient to trains, but in seedy part of town”
Reviews.Author: verikastanton
Reviews.Content: My opinion of this hotel is a little schizophrenic. We chose this hotel for the last night of our trip through Southern Spain and Northern France because it was adjacent to the car rental return, where we needed to drop off our car before flying out early the following morning. We figured it would be convenient to both returning the car and getting a cab to the airport. Both were true. However, I had forgotten from being there in the 90's as a backpacker how seedy the area is. In general, train stations in Europe can be infused with seedy scammers looking to pick-pocket, etc., and the train station in Barcelona is not really any exception. Even the employees at the car rental (Hertz) were a little obviously paranoid about someone coming into their business if they didn't have a reservation. HOWEVER, this hotel upstairs from the station was actually very nice. We returned a day early from our driving and they accommodated us with an extra night prior to our reservation. It is more upscale than the average hotel, the food was decent, although not very "authentic" to Spanish food, it was of good quality. The people were friendly, speak English very well, and the rooms were truly sound-proof as described. Where it lacks in charm, it makes up for in cleanliness and "modern" accommodations. I generally prefer the quaint, smaller, homier hotels, but this fulfilled our need, which was a convenient place to sleep between car return and flight. Since we came back a day early, we did some sightseeing again on our extra day in the city, and nothing is really close by to see on foot, but you can get a subway train or a taxi very easily. Just hang on to your bags, your kids, and anything else valuable and keep your peripheral vision acute until you get out of the immediate area of the train station. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a long-term stay, as we found a much more quaint hotel in the heart of the Jewish Quarter for our initial 3 nights stay in Barcelona where we could walk to sites, markets, restaurants, and the Rambla, but if you are renting a car or taking a train out of town, or if you want something more "American" and modern, this hotel does just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: studyabroadhoya
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Sants hotel has one of the most ideal locations for travel throughout the city and perhaps farther. The hotel itself is beautiful, the staff are friendly and fortunately all spoke English. While the train between the station and the airport is not currently running and there is construction outside of the hotel, none of that is the hotel's fault or problem. Furthermore, my boyfriend and I used the metro from the station, never venturing directly outside the hotel for sightseeing since that's not the main part of Barcelona anyway. I have never been happier with a hotel for location versus value. As for the room, it was clean, large and had a beautiful view. My one suggestion would have been a more comfortable bed and bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigger73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelo Sants for 2 nights and after the first night I seriously considered checking out! An indicator of things to come is when you go in search of the train at the Airport to be told that due to building work its not running but there is a free bus. Approaching the train station/hotel you quickly realise how extensive the building work is! Trying to walk anywhere from the hotel involves an obstacle course and the need for a face mask to avoid the dust! Twice I tried to walk and twice I gave up and walked back to the train station to get the metro. While I stayed there the was a constant noise and vibration from industrial concrete breakers that goes on well into the evening (past 9pm!) and starts again early morning. I felt very sorry for the airline staff that are constantly checking in during the day, obviously looking forward to being able to stay away from the airport and see a bit of the city only to be faced with a building site and little chance of sleep during the day! Add to this the dust the work creates coming into the hotel, very hard beds, tired looking rooms and paper thin walls & doors and noisy toilets I would not recomend this hotel at the moment. Oh and watch out for the scolding hot water coming out of the shower, trying to get warm water takes time and skill, I ended up running a bath for safety sake! I hope the development of a fast Airport rail link might prompt the hotel to re-vamp the rooms until then I would avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Good access to transportation, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Stanislov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night, and most of my comments are similar to others' critiques. Very easy access from the airport - frequent trains take you to Barcelona Sants station and the hotel is right on top of the station (elevator in the station takes you right to the lobby). A metro station is here as well, making it convenient to get to wherever you're going on Barcelona's excellent subway lines. Other than that, the hotel is pretty drab, rooms are small, beds are hard, and the walls are paper-thin (noisy throughout the night). And, as expected for a train station area, the neighbourhood seems fairly seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad features”
Reviews.Author: sffooddude
Reviews.Content: Good location (train station below with subway directly to airport) and excellent breakfast help to make up for drab room and budget bed (they haven't figured out that Starwood's "Heavenly Bed" sells hotel rooms quite well, I guess). Bathroom is not bad, with marble and even a bidet, but toiletries also felt budget. The price was outlandish during a large conference: at 245 euro, not a good value (but would have been a much better value at prices others mention here off peak). Despite the train station, the neighborhood felt pretty safe even later at night. Overall, not horrible but there are better choices unless you need really easy, cheap airport access.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Sants- Third Visit”
Reviews.Author: Marcus2000
Reviews.Content: On my third visit to this hotel, I have decided to update my review. Over the past four years, the quality of the hotel rooms has deteriorated. The rooms, although spacious, look old. The air conditioning is poor (and a bit noisey) and in both rooms I had (we switched) there were cracks in the ceiling. The receptionist miscommunicated some information to us about the upgrade, and then denied it. (not at all friendly) Although it is useful for the metro/rail system, the underground walk to the line that takes you into Catalunya, is long and hot...IF you are visiting barcelona, get a hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, cheap and very acceptable”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: It may not be the most stunning 4* hotel in Europe but this Barcelo hotel is fine. It does seem a little bit neglected (carpets) and changes are needed (beds are not the most comfortable). On the other hand it has an ideal location in Barcelona and I would not hesitate to come back. I paid 85usd plus taxes on Hotwire.com

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but rooms were subpar”
Reviews.Author: phworld
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and thought this would be a convenient hotel to stay at since it was situated on top of the main station. When we arrived, the hotel exterior looked nice and new. Even the lobby was expansive when we entered. However, when we saw our rooms, it was old and appeared like it hadn't been kept up for many years. The biggest problem was that their air conditioner doesn't really work well (more like an ineffective fan) so the rooms felt like an oven. They basically hadn't invested in the upkeep of the hotel rooms. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “God send for busy travellors”
Reviews.Author: Sanpip
Reviews.Content: We splurged our last night in Spain to stay at this hotel, after staying at hostals and cheaper hotels for the rest of our stay, so my review will definitely be influenced by that. I can't compare with other hotels at the same price. It was a God send for us because we arrived by plane from Madrid in the early evening and were flying out the next morning, so its location right at the train station was so perfect for us. Easy access to the metro to get anywhere, as well, not sure about walking distances since we didn't walk. The room, especially the bathroom, was big, compared to what we had stayed in before. Comparing to other hotels I've stayed at I'd say that it was still bigger than average. Huge tub. We didn't get the chance to try out any of the services (room service, gym, etc.). The internet however, was way over-priced at 3Euros for 1/2 hour. Would definitely recommend this place if you are doing a lot of traveling in and out of the city. Not recommended if you want to be in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for train travellers!”
Reviews.Author: No1Fox
Reviews.Content: If you travel in or out of Barcelona by train, no hotel is more handy! It is situated directly above the train station and entry to the hotel is via a lift (elevator) situated inside the station, (on north side of station ground level), but it's not as easy to find as it could be. The rooms have ADSL. Whilst they claim the rooms are "soundproof", they are not; however, they are quiet. Lots of road works going on (6/07), but tour buses stop across the street and it's easy to get to main part of town if you have a map. Beds are not as cofortable as they could be. We "fixed" that by putting blankets under the sheet and then we were fine. Bathroom is large and bright enough to do makeup. Did not try inhouse restaurant, but lots of others did. They also have a car park in case you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Madrebt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better than I expected for being on top of the train station. It's a great location if you want to be close to the train. If you want to hang out on Las Ramblas, better to stay there. Metro stops running at midnight during the week and you'll need to catch a cab back to Sants. You will definitely not be done by midnight. And it's very easy to get here during the day from anywhere in Barcelona via the Metro. It's one of the best in Europe. The hotel, itself, however was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: IrishTravellerDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Barcelo Sants for 5 nights as part of a group. The location of the hotel is excellent for anyone intending to get access to city centre or to locations outside of Barcelona as it is situated directly above Barcelona's central train station. Overall the hotel's public areas are spacious and access is easy. Our impression of the hotel was poor based on an expectation of a 3 -4 star rating. Although the staff were quite friendly there were a number of issues that took away from our otherwise positive experience of Barcelona. One problem we had related to the an air-conditioning system that leaked directly into our wardrobe and which was repaired by placing one of our bathroom towels into the ceiling. Having politely requested another room in the fear that the leak would saturate the towel and resume saturating our clothes we were refused on two separate occasions. Breakfast was very good with a full buffet however the cost would encourage you to get a good two hours eating in before exploring the city; drinks in the bar were also very expensive. The rooms themselves were basic and small and in our view would not conform with a rating of 3-4 stars. We checked out of the hotel with the feeling that the accomodation was overpriced and that our concerns in relation to the poor condition of the room were not taken seriously. For those making a booking online do beware of asking for a confirmation via email; you may run the risk of it being returned along with your entire credit card details in an unsecured email. The hotel could be recommended for overnight stays but is not the ideal location for the duration of your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TCobb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelo Hotel Sants because of the semi-positive feedback and tripadvisor ranking and because it is right on top of Sants Estacion in Barcelona. We didn't want to have to pay a taxi to get from the airport to the hotel and then back, and the train was not a hassle, and even a tremendous convenience for us. Saved us a good bit of change. I was wary of how nice, clean, and modern the hotel room would be and about the service we would receive based on other reviews, and all my expectations were completely exceeded. The room though styled not to my taste was very clean, semi-modern and very spacious compared to our other lodging on this trip to Europe. The bathroom had a bidet (yes!), and the tub actually drained very quickly while showering and didn't pool any water. The desk staff was absolutely incredibly helpful. I speak Castellano (castillian) and even though the language spoken in Barcelona is Catalan, the desk staff was very eager to help me in Castellano and even in very crisp and clear English when the situation warranted. I wish I could remember the name of the woman who helped us, but she was phenomenal in showing us on the map where almost every single attraction in the city is that we would want to see, and then showed us where good places to eat were nearby each site, and then showed us how to get to where we wanted to go on the Metro. We bought a T10 metro ticket which gives you up to 10 entries into the metro system and can be used by multiple people, and for the 3 days we spent in Barcelona it was perfect. My only complaints about this hotel were that the bed was pretty stiff and the first day when my wife and I slept in, we woke up with pretty sore backs, and that the Wifi internet access is pretty expensive. At least they offer it though and it works great!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: HT1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of a large group. Hotel is a busy business hotel with standard amenities. Rooms, while clean need modernisation. Staff indifferent. Breakfast very good. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It is perched ontop of a train station with direct access to the airport and city. While not city centre it is convenient as a result. No other reason to chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and thats all”
Reviews.Author: redrabbits123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 5*, 4*, 3* hotels and b&bs and this was in no way as good as any of them. To call this a 4* hotel is a complete misrepresentation. The only thing going for it is the location, 20 minutes from the airport by train, into the lift and straight up to reception what more can one ask? Well, where shall I start? We arrived at reception were the service was brisk if a little abrupt, we went up to our room on the 2nd floor and what a dump, talk about dated and shabby, this place had it all, in the bedroom there were cigarette burns in the carpet and on the furniture (this was a no smoking room!) the wooden furniture was chipped, the wallpaper was peeling and the bathroom was not much better with its mouldy bath surround and big gaps in the tile grouting. We had noticed on the way in that there was a special offer to upgrade to an executive room for 22€ per night, we decided that our room was so bad we would upgrade, we were given a room on the 6th floor and were gobsmacked to walk in and find that the only difference between the rooms was a 2 seater sofa - presumably for executives to lounge on. Again the room was shabby, their were cigarette burns in the furniture, the bed was like a brick, wallpaper was peeling in places and the whole room was dated. Again the bathroom had large areas of grout missing and the bath surround was very mouldy. There was a hairdrier fixed to the bathroom wall but the hose was too short to pull across therefore I had to stand between the loo and the bidet to use it! And the towels were grey, thin, scratchy and stained. I will say that that the breakfasts were good for the money, typically continental and American fare but plenty of it and seemed fresh. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for trains”
Reviews.Author: otismyman
Reviews.Content: If convenience for the Metro and trains is top of your list, stay here. However, if you want a comfortable, up-to-date hotel that understands what an ice bucket is, go somewhere else. My family and I stayed here during the Easter break and were quite disappointed in a number of ways. The first is that the heat was on so high, we had to strip down to our underwear every time we came back to our room. Hence the request for an ice bucket. What did we get? Two stryofoam cups full of ice. Not too good for cooling the wine. The mattress on the bed was like a plank. On our next-to-last night, the room was so oppressively hot, we had to open our door, as did others on our floor. When I spoke to someone in reception, she said nowhere in the hotel was cool. Yet, the lobby felt remarkably cooler than our hothouse of a room. On our last night a busload of Germans arrived, and I told my husband we would have air conditioning that night. We did, and we froze. We can recommend the ARS restaurant in the station for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Laura24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were very impressed. Very easy to get to from the airport - short train ride and the hotel is right above the train station (although we didn't realise that at first and wandered around outside for a bit looking lol). The reception staff were very friendly and spoke good english. The hotel appearance was quite nice too. The rooms were big and spacious enough with good facilities and a nice bathroom. We were on the 8th floor I think looking out on to the square. It was very handy to have the tour bus stop outside the station for the south loop route. Also, it was very easy to get a taxi from the hotel, they call one for you and it is at the front door within minutes. The fare to placa catalunya (spelling?) was very reasonable and it only took 5mins. We didn't sample any of the restaurants at the hotel but from past reviews I wish I tried the breakfast. Even though the hotel is located away a bit from the city centre, it wouldn't put me off booking to stay there again in the future, and for the price it is definately worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, functional”
Reviews.Author: jennidSpain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 6th to 10th of March. We booked a double room and the bed was larger than a UK king size. The room was a fair size with a minibar but no tea/coffee making facilities. The tv had a couple of English and American news channels. The bathroom was a bit tired with some mildew around the bath edge. Overall the hotel is clean and functional but the decor is a bit dated. As stated in previous reviews there is a metro station under the hotel and this is the great advantage to staying here. We took the metro every morning to the Las Ramblas area for breakfast at the La Boqueria food market. Worth doing. One night we ate in the hotel restaurant where the staff were very friendly and the food quality and presentation excellent ,and fairly priced. The tourist bus also has a stop outside the train station underneath the hotel. Would recommend buying the 2 day ticket as there is so much to see in Barcelona. Would stay at this hotel again, very convenient if you are arriving or departing the city by train, but I would request a room away from the lifts as it can be a noisy area.

Reviews.Title: “sheer convenience”
Reviews.Author: WokingTravelman
Reviews.Content: The thing about this hotel is its convenience. The train from the airport goes directly to Sants station and the hotel has an entrance inside the station. It is only one stop on the metro to the Ramblas. The hotel sits on top of the station but you are totally unaware of noise from the trains. The rooms are functional, modern and comfortable. We were well pleased with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: sensameliablue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from a sunday to a tuesday. We were checked in straight away by friendly staff. Our room was very basic. Bathroom was a good size. However it was good value for money at £55 per night. The hotel was a little out of the way for going out and about to anywhere interesting! It was above the train station however we found it difficult to navigate the train timetables. Woudl recommend for cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but outside main action scene (yet accessible)”
Reviews.Author: newintown0
Reviews.Content: We paid 129$ a night. Nice hotel. You can take a taxi to many places. Right below there is train station you can get access to the city and other places. Taxi cost about 15 euros. Monserat is a place to see (45 min train ride). Like any other hotel, bit expensive drinks & food.

Reviews.Title: “Very 80` style !”
Reviews.Author: DolBrayIreland
Reviews.Content: Three females travelled from Dublin on 9th December to Barcelona. I had got the name of the hotel on the internet. I made a mistake and thought it was beside Placa Catalunya - however it was only 1 stop from their by train. The hotel is 20 minutes from the airport. A double room for 4 nights cost €300 - excellent value - I had a room to myself for the same cost. We took a trip to Sitges - just by walking down stairs to the station. It is also the main station to many other destinations in Spain. The hotel staff were very friendly. Breakfast was fit for a King - at €12 to dine in style was good value. However, evening dinner was neither good value nor good food ! I would recommend this hotel for a cheap place to stay - it seems to be mainly business people and was quite empty on the weekend - we stayed Saturday to Wednesday. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: OKAussie
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel in Barcelona & one night in Apsis Splendid. As a tourist, I have to say that it was more suited to Business folks because it could have been a hotel in just about any city in the world. Not Spain. There was absolutely no character in this hotel. However, on the other hand the rooms are comfortable, clean, spacious & its above the train station. So you can easily get just about anywhere by train or metro. Walking is also an option but have comfy shoes for this city. The staff were very helpful & gave plenty of advice. We did our own breakfast rather than eat in house as I heard it was not up to scratch. They have internet for a small price, a bar that looks inviting & lots of lifts. But as I said in the beginning if you're looking for Spanish influence you won't find it here. Its a cut & dry business hotel. But they do it well.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else unless you have to travel frequently by train”
Reviews.Author: dimsum
Reviews.Content: The only good thing for this hotel was its location right on top of the train station. Other than that, 'nothing special' was already a very good comment to the hotel. This was the worst hotel in my two weeks trip in Spain. Bad smell inside our room and our bathtub was blocked by a used soap (It was a nightmare when I picked up the soap, left by the previous guest, as I thought it was the plug)!!!! The room was very dated, and to be precise, the whole hotel was very dated. It was the Barcelona biannual festival when we stayed at the hotel. We asked the front desk for information on the festival and their answer was that they didn't know anything about the festival. The internet corner was not free. People was allowed to smoke in the lobby. Although the room rate was not expensive, not cheap either. Money could be better spent in other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: hemmesfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sants from Sept 24th-Oct1st. We were greetly warmly and the hotel staff was very helpful thoughout our stay. They were quick to give us info on places to see, things to do and how to get to them. It is a perfect location with the train, bus and subway connected underneath the hotel. In that station you will also find a McDonalds and shopping which is nice if you don't want to run out someplace far. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were very clean. The only negatives would be that the breakfast was a bit on the expensive side and not all that good. We didn't try any other meals there to compare. Also the internet is not free and is expensive as well. I would reccomend this hotel with confidence. I

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jack-williams
Reviews.Content: I stayed in barcelo sants many years ago but will review it after passing through barcelona recently and staying in much inferior hotel that never pleased like the sants did. The location is great (over the main train station) and the rooms, the bar and the facilities are very good. I would recommend this especially for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Stay!”
Reviews.Author: johnstar24
Reviews.Content: During my one week trip to Barcelona i stayed at Barcelo Sants Hotel as park of a pre-booked football package for Nou Camp home of FC Barcelona so i didn’t have a choice of hotel so i didn’t really know what to expect although before my trip i knew the hotels location was extremely good as its located fairly close to the airport and also has a metro station within a 30 seconds walking distance. I read quite a few reviews and they were mixed, most of the negative comments were regarding too much noise, poor service etc. I found the staff quite competent and polite and didn’t have any problems with any of the staff, there was no noise issues whatsover and the rooms really shocked me in a good way as they were so spacious and for around 40 euros per night too. The shower and bathroom was very well kept and cleaners made sure towels etc were replaced. This hotel is so unique because of its location which is set inside a huge mall area where there are newsagents, shops, and even restaurants (McDonalds) and cafes and a train station! Once you leave the mall area you just cross the road to get to the metro station and from there you can travel anywhere in the city within ten minutes which was fantastic. The only negative i can find for this hotel was the buffet breakfast (10 euros) which is very overpriced and over-rated, some of the food was ok but there simply wasnt enough choice so thats the one area that they need to improve on but the bottom line is i would stay here again in future and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, business hotel right above the train station”
Reviews.Author: CaliSwissMiss
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Hotel Sants literally sits right on top of the main train station in Barcelona. It was very convenient, considering the train from the airport comes right here and there is a metro station here too that takes you right into the heart of the city. There is a good tourist information booth within the train station too. There is a stairwell & elevator in the train station that goes right up to the hotel. USE IT! We missed it and almost got our stuff stolen outside the station by a pair of scam artists who threw a yellow, watery mixture on my travel pack and offered to clean it for me. Also beware of pickpockets! The hotel itself is a very nice, big business hotel with all the amenities. It lacks the charm of staying in the center of the city, but the rooms are very clean and the price is good (about 100 Euros for a double room). It is very comfortable and surprisingly quiet, considering it is so close to the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: jenster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while on holiday on the Costa Brava. We booked this hotel as it was recommended by a friend from Barcelona and was one of the only decent looking places for less than 250 euros. The handy access from the station is good but not well signposted so you can walk in a circle trying to find it! This entrance closes however at 12pm and the only other way in we saw was up some steep metal stairs which looked like they'd be a nightmare if you'd had a few cavas in town. The Bus Touristic also stops right outside on it's blue line which was handy, although the bus was packed every time it came past and we couldn't always get on the first one that came. This bus also only runs until 8pm, when it changes into a nighttime tour that you have to pay again for. The room was OK - spacious and with a great view of the city, but it just seemed to be really dated, I think the choice of green for all the wood etc was a bad one. The bed was absolutely massive, and a welcome relief from the tiny campbed we had been on in our selfcatering apartment. The bathroom however was about the same quality as in our apartment - cracked tiles, missing sealant around the bath, 30 year old rusty taps. Really disappointing. We decided to have breakfast in the hotel and that was also pretty disappointing. A reasonable selection but they could have done so much more. A lot of the things they listed on the breakfast advert in the room weren't actually available, like milkshakes which were specified as being a feature (cue one disappointed husband!!). If you do stay here also check out the vending machines on the reception floor by the gym - bottled water is 55 cents here rather than the 2.50 the minibar charges, and it stocks icecreams too. I'd say for a handy location (if you're travelling from the Sants station) and the price (cheap for Barcelona), this is a good place to stay but don't expect great things.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Holiday I've Had”
Reviews.Author: LauraSheri
Reviews.Content: This was the first time me and my boyfriend went away together and this hotel was fantastic. Yeah maybe the staff could be a little more friendly but so what......I really didn't care. The hotel is in the most perfect position above the main station. Getting the lift down one floor and jumping on which ever Metro I wanted was so easy and on 1 euro.....and i'm a bit thinck when it comes to these kind of thing. Barcelonas Metro system is the best i've seen yet. You can go anywhere and get home from anywhere......so easy, so many stations. I'm deffo going back......ignore all the bad reviews it's great!! Booked on www.tobook.com - really cheap deal!

Reviews.Title: “A Safe Bet”
Reviews.Author: hirakata
Reviews.Content: Not the most architecturally appealing of buildings, the good rate and convenient location (right over the main station but so quiet you would never know it !) make this hotel a good bet. A blend of business men and what seemed to be independent travellers/ holiday makers was a bit funny. Rooms clean and in good condition if a bit dated and dark. Aircon was effective - thank God as there were no windonws that could be opened. Staff were efficient if cold and as has been said before you have to pay for anything in additon - like the safety box in the room. All in all a safe bet

Reviews.Title: “All right but would try another”
Reviews.Author: can80an
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Many grocery stores nearby. Saved $ on eating in, snacks - Hotel in station good. After travelling 8hrs from Toulouse by train, being able to exit train area and walk up to hotel elevator very comforting. Didn't have to bother with taxis - Laundromat 10min walk - Decent desk help. Most staff that I had to talk to was helpful and/or polite regardless if they had trouble understanding English - Room is similar to American standard Con - When I opened my towel it had huge disgusting brown stains. Luckily I brought my own, so I used this for rest of my stay. Why would they reuse a stained towel? - Either hotel or housekeeping don't know their own policy. In bathroom, there's a hotel sign to the effect of "Help save the environment. Reuse towel. If you want a new one put it on side of tub." Simple right? Well, we hung our towels on the hangars but they took it off. Big deal, right? So, they folded it up for us. Wrong. They took my towel away when they saw I had one of my own. Can't I have two? - Didn't replace toiletries. 1 used bar of soap. Not replaced. So, we used the shower gel as hand soap. Once those 2 bottles were used up...not replaced. Kleenex box empty. Not replaced. Down to last roll of toilet paper on roller...not replaced. 6 nights of this, we didn't complain cause we were able to get along with bare minimum. But on the last roll of toilet paper my friend got annoyed with service. She called down for 1 box of Kleenex, 1 roll of toilet paper. Staff brought us 2 rolls of toilet paper. - Walls very thin. Can hear piano/singing downstairs, noise in hall, noise upstairs

Reviews.Title: “Clean but charmless”
Reviews.Author: pcintx
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at the Barcelo Sants. It is a modern business hotel on top of the train station and totally sterile and charmless, and Barcelona has so many neighborhoods to stay in that are totally charming that I can't see the point of making the trip to stay at the Sants. The rooms, however, are big, very clean and reasonably priced. You will have to take the bus or metro to see the sights. And you will have to go to the Placa Espana if you want to take the train to Monserrat, there is no direct train from the Sants train station, although you can take the Metro to the Placa. I recommend staying in the Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTimmis
Reviews.Content: It was quite simple really! We arrived by air and took the main Airport Bus straight to the front of the hotel. The hotel was clean, in great condition, cool and the rooms comfortable and modern. The location was excellent as it was above the main train station with metro routes available right throughout the city. The hotel had its own lift from the station, which was open till 11pm. Once this was shut then it was quite easy to climb the well-lit stairs on the side of the hotel. I am sure there are more quaint hotels with a central location but this one was excellent quality, price and with Taxi's and metro trains was accessible and a great hideaway!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant .quietand comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marcia Mae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barcelo Sants on the 31st o March and 1st of April. Rooms are pleasant and clean, quiet (over the train station.) Good value for money. Desk personel very hepful. Easy to take tourist bus out front. Rated above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is in a great spot...on top of the train station. Easy to get on the metro, rent a car, or catch a train, but--and this is a big "but"--their staff was extremely rude and arrogant, and doesn't know the first thing about customer service. I remembered choosing between this hotel, and the hotel expo on hotels, and choosing this one because it has a fitness center (use not included in room rate), and because they offered a free breakfast(or at least I thought they did). Upon check in, I asked the deskperson if the room rate included breakfast. He said "yes", and that there was a buffet-style breakfast each day, and that the cost was 2 euros. Free?...2E?...whatever, "close enough", I thought. Next morning, we come downstairs hungry, and the woman behind the register at the buffet asks for 25 euros for breakfast! I tell her that our room was supposed to include the buffet for a special price of 2E. She responds that there's no 2E breakfast and that there's absolutely nothing she can do. I remain calm and ask who I can talk to about it. She points me to the front desk. I go to the front desk and speak with another gentleman (the arrogant one), explaining the situation. He says the same thing as the woman at the buffet. I explain that I remember vividly, choosing this hotel because they had a special deal including breakfast. He says "estas equivocado"...you're wrong. Through all of this being told that I'm mistaken and that there's nothing they can do, I remained very calm and polite. And finally, I tell him that "in the future, you all should check to make sure that your webpage is updated and accurate." He says to me, "there's no problem with the webpage." To which I respond, "I distinctly remember seeing free breakfast on the webpage." And he says (with nose high in the air), "no es posible"...that's impossible. The most upsetting part of all this was not the fact that we didn't get what we thought we were getting when we made the reservation, but the fact that they were not willing to consider--for even a moment--that THEY could be wrong. And on top of that, we're talking about a buffet here. They're gonna cook the food anyway, either it gets eaten or gets thrown away. Either they could get 4E from us, and we would eat some of the food they would be throwing away, and leave satisfied customers....Or they could insist that I was wrong, do nothing, throw away the food, get no money, and get a bad review for their rude service...which they have now gotten. So take your chances if you want, but the expo is less than a block away, and comparably priced. I would never stay at the Barcelo Sants again. As a hotel, to think you can get away with giving terrible customer service is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and found it to be an excellent base - with bus, train, metro and tourist bus links on hand. I had read some previous reviews which were critical of the buffet breakfast but at 12 euro it represented fair value. Rooms are warm and must be uncomfortable in the height of summer but we had two room keys and kept one in the slot for air conditioning,lighting most of the time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “No direct train from the airport.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews, I was sort of looking forward to the convenience this hotel provides, transportation-wise. I was disappointed to learn that since December of 2005, the formerly direct train from the Barcelona airport to the in-hotel station is under repair. Yes, you can still take the train. But it involves leaving from the airport, going a stop or two away, unloading all your luggage, going down a set of stairs and then up another set of stairs and getting on another train. No escalator available. While it's obviously cheaper than a taxi, I certainly don't recommend it. There are also buses available which leave from the airport train station (go across the overhead pedestrian bridge from the airport to the train station, pass the ticket booth and go out the front doors)to the Sants station, a better option for the budget-minded traveler, than the train. While it was definitely nice to have the metro actually inside the building, it didn't seem to make up for the depressing look and feel of the hotel. It has all the charm of an over-tired Holiday Inn. The desk staff are polite, helpful and speak quite enough English to more than adequately handle any situation. And my room was cleaned well, each day. So, zero problem with service. It's just the drab surroundings of a hotel in desperate need of a makeover which really didn't help. That and not being able to walk outside and have anything I really wanted to see, nearby. Next time, I plan to stay somewhere in the Eixemple district. Preferably near the Grand Via metro station. I more than capable of walking a block or two to the metro. And it's worth a couple cab rides to and from the airport, to me, to stay in an area boasting excellent restaurants, and all the other things I'll enjoy. I would have been much happier. As it is, you walk the equivalent of probably a few blocks to go from the Barcelo Sants Hotel lobby down to the green line metro stop in the building. So you aren't saving a lot of steps, unless you plan to ride the blue line, exclusively. And to echo what others have said, watch your belongings in the Sants station. A man had his wallet stolen, right in front of me, while riding up a packed escalator in the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel..cheap considering it was 4 star..staff were great and the location couldnt be bettered. The room was hot but we asked for a fan and they gave it to us in minutes. Thanks for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's a cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirabel
Reviews.Content: Everyone seems enamoured of this place but we booked for 2 nights and hot-footed it out of there after one. This hotel is one of those 70s style boxes with non-opening windows, hallucination-inducing carpet and thin walls. The room was so hot and airless we could barely breathe, and there was no way to control the temperature.(This was January, we aren't talking a hot day). We asked to be moved, and were, to a room 4 doors away, which had the a similar problem. There were signs everywhere attesting to the quality of the air in the hotel. Methinks they do protest too much - it must be an ongoing issue. On a positive note, the rooms are clean and large with big bathrooms, and the staff are polite. The location is not that great - you have to take a crowded subway to get anywhere. We opted to go to a hotel in town where we could walk to places (and happily paid a lot more money for it). There seemed to be quite a few couples having fun (thin walls) and there's a good bar, so they probably thought it was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Narinder
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day stay at Barcelo Sants. The hotel is excellent and i would highly recommend it. The customer service was top notch, with friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms with room service and many extra's at reasonable rates. The hotel itself is in a centrel location, with easy access to all the sites and considering it is above a busy train station we never felt any noise. I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bustamove
Reviews.Content: Went for this hotel after reading reviews on this site, and was not disapointed. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport as the train goes straight from the airport to the train station below the hotel. The station also has many places to eat and easy access to the metro and the tourist bus. The staff were friendly and were able to get us a reservation at the city's top mexican restaurant at short notice. Rooms were nice and bright with large windows and we had a good view of the city below. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Terms of Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location and the friendly staff (With the exception of the bar-lounge bartenders) is GREAT. A very good deal for you money! Even though, they can do better in terms of closet space (only four draws per room.) The train station is directly under the hotel lobby it easily provides access to two different trains plus other forms of transportation. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mely
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Sants Hotel is located right above the major train station in Barcelona, Barcelo Sants, so both trains and buses arrive there. It is highly convenient if you're arriving late via bus or train. The hotel itself is great. I usually don't expect much from European hotels, but this was a major exception. The room was big, the bathroom was big, we had a king size bed, and fresh fruit was waiting for us in our room. The staff is courteous, accomodating, and very friendly. They kept stored our bags at no extra charge the last day that we were there and the use of their computers to access the Internet was free. The location is super convenient if you're going to be using the Metro to get around the city. If not, taxis and buses are also accessible from the hotel. I would definetely go back there and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, needs some elbow grease”
Reviews.Author: johnscott
Reviews.Content: This Hotel sits right on top the train station, and sub way system, which is good if you're traveling by train or a little on the cheap, getting in late via train, I would recomend this Hotel for American college kids, or twenty somethings saving a buck. The negatives are its really pewtrid in decor, andthe breakfast is really marginal, but just go on the lower level where the train station is for breakfast. (Basically, to much volume being pushed through the Hotel) The biggest negative for me was the Hotel could have been cleaner, this really irks me when a Hotel is dirty. A much nicer Hotel for only 20 or 30 bucks more would be the Fira Palace were I stayed a month ago, its in the same area, more quiet, close to the park, and subway system, and very clean and not as hectic.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: The_Truffles
Reviews.Content: When someone tells you that this hotel sits above the major train station in Barcelona, your expectations may not be high. Indeed, when you arrive at the Plaza dels Paisos Catalanes, you may wonder what happened to the beautiful Barcelona you'd seen so much of in the guide book. But fear not - what this hotel lacks in terms of 'prettiness', it more than makes up for with it's extremely friendly and helpful staff (who could not have been more accomodating), clean modern rooms, good selection of bars and restaurants and a well equipped gym. The very fact that the hotel is a mere 2,60 euro train ride away from the airport almost makes it worth staying here on its own (I have never experienced such a cheap transfer before). On the basis of this experience, we would almost certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, nice clean rooms! And also very quiet! If you're going to barcelona to see all the sights. Tourist bus stops outside of hotel - this is brilliant, takes you everywhere, cheap enough at 17 euros for one day or 23 for two days! Get on and off as much as you like. Hotel just above train station, ideal to get around. La Ramblas is about 2-3 miles away and costs approx 9 euros if you decide to take taxi. Highly recommend hotel, all staff friendly and speak english brilliantly. Would definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, super choice”
Reviews.Author: Oatesy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from spending 4 nights at the Barcelo Sants Hotel in Barcelona. We were very impressed overall, and found it to offer excellent value for money. Its location, above a major train station is a great advantage, making travel to the various sights a formality, and it was so easy to get to and from the airport too! The park next to the hotel (Parc Espanya Industrial) is perfect for early morning croisaants and coffee before starting the day in earnest. The air conditioning is pure heaven after a hot day out and about, and the super king sized beds were very comfortable indeed. If I had any recommendations to make- it would be that the decor needs a bit of updating, but on the whole I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Jerks for staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel. Situated above the Sants metro station, which makes it easy to get around. The hotel restaurant is extremely overpriced, so don't eat there. There are many other good restaurants located in the area, especially on or near Calle Vallespir. Services are overpriced as well, such as phone calls and laundry services. There is a laundromat at 136 Vallespir and a supermarket across the street. Personally, I'd recommend staying somewhere closer to Las Ramblas or Plaza Catalunya. There is a major metro station there and lots of shops and sites nearby. One local I spoke to said the area in which the Barcelo Hotel is located is kind of dangerous at night. The staff can be quite rude as well. This is a business hotel, and I'm sure all the desk staff can speak Castilian as well as Catalan because both are taught in Spanish schools. Yet when I arrived, the two girls at the desk refused to speak to me in Castilian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: May 2005. My son and I stayed at the Barcelo Sants for 4 nights. We couldn't believe that a hotel above a train station/subway was so quiet. The location was great -easy subway rides to tourist highlights and direct train to/from airport and we liked the neighborhood cafes too for our morning coffee and croissant or late night dinners. Nice room and spacious bathroom. We got a great rate online and they gave us a room on the top floor (7th) with a view. Professional staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The hotel is above the Sants station and is absoutely fantastic for its location! The train goes straight from the airport to the station and within few minutes, you can be sitting in your hotel room without the fuss of wandering around a new city looking for streets that don't exist on your tourist guide. A word of warning though, the lift that takes you from the station to the hotel above closes at midnight so if you come back to the hotel via metro later than midnight it does mean a walk up the entrance for cars, a steep ramp uphill with no walkway for pedestrians. However I recommend that you can get taxis as they are extremely cheap (about 4-7 Euros depending on where you are) and easy to catch anywhere around Barcelona. The people that moan about it not being near the action must have been in another hotel as the Metro was so accessible (being just below the hotel!) and as I said, taxis were very good value for money. The soundproofing does work as we could not hear the noise from the station. The air con was fantastic and kept us cool during the gorgeously hot weather! I agree with other people that the rooms need updating as our safe and fridge wasn't working but the staff are wonderful and gave us a new room straight away. The room is a good enough size with a nice bathroom and a lovely view of Barcelona. If you're looking for luxury, this hotel is not it but the hotel is terrific for people who truly want to sightsee Barcelona as it is in a fantastic location, it is clean and the beds are comfy! A night time visit to Cafe Zurich is essential (at the end of the Las Ramblas, Catalunya station), perfect for people watching. The food and drink prices around Barcelona are fantastic. The Hard Rock Cafe is fantastic for anyone wanting a good old juicy burger. All in all, I had a wonderful stay and Barcelo Hotel Sants is the perfect hotel for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelo Sants for 4 nights in March 2005 and found the hotel to live up to our expectations. The location is great as it is located right above the train, bus and metro stations. Service to the airport, the rest of Spain (and even France) and elsewhere in the city are fast and practical. The hotel has its own entrance directly in the station. Also, for those who do not want to eat at the hotel restaurant, the station has several restaurants which are not expensive. The room was big enough, clean, and the service impeccable. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: Peegee
Reviews.Content: I would agree with a previous reviewer that this is more a 3 star than a 4 star hotel. The rooms are decorated in a sort of "Hotel '80s" style, but are clean and spacious. The lobby is a desert - the bar is open in the evenings, but there is absolutely no atmosphere, so don't bother. Room service and mini bar are expensive - my advice is to buy snacks and beer from the supermarket across the road! TV is OK - there are channels in 4 languages. Location is as others have said - as it's not in the centre and a little pricey, the weekend tourists tend to miss it, so it's reasonably quiet. The beds are very hard, though! The station links to everywhere in Spain - we went to Girona for a day, and it was cheap and quick. As others have mentioned, the breakfast is 12 Euros, so the station is a better bet, but do understand that we are talking station cafeterias here - not fancy eating, by any means! However, we got fresh orange juice, coffee and croissant for around 4 Euro per person. The biggest problem is the price of "extras". Wi-Fi costs 5 Euros for an hour or 12 Euros for 24 hours BUT everytime we asked for a 24 hour card they had mysteriously "run out". The safe costs around 4 Euros a day - extraordinary! However, the bathroom extras are fun - I brought back two combs, a shaving kit and a spare toothbrush! The staff speak English, but the service is standard Spanish (as far as I can work out). Let's just say that the concept of "customer service" and/or "service with a smile" has not reached most of Spain yet, and this hotel is no exception. In summary, this hotel is good for a shortish break, but more than 7 nights would get tedious, I think

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: virginbride
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barcelo Sants For 3 nights for a well needed girlie weekend.Hotel location was brilliant, being just above train station, rooms were clean & comfortable,reception staff were helpful & efficient (pointed us in direction of ice machine & provided iron & board.)The tour bus stops right outside the station which is handy & u must have breakfast in restaurants within the station much cheaper than the hotel & excellent variety.oh yes,the lift from the station closes at midnight so take a taxi back to the hotel after your night out & it will eject you right to the hotel door. Have fun in Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, spotless rooms, staff were so friendly and helpful. The location was excellent right above the train station, next to the bus station for reus airport, perfect if flying into reus with ryanair. taxi rank next to hotel. The bar restaurant and gym were great additions too. Id highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and would come again”
Reviews.Author: Lalayna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Amazing value for price. Recommend staying here and I would definetly stay here again. Clean lush rooms with amazing views of Barcelona. Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms, towles, tolietries cleaned and replaced daily. Choice of non smoking room. Breakfast is a bit xxxy but hey there are shops on ground level with plenty of choice. Location Location.....very easy to get around as is on top of train station and brilliant once arriving of long plane journey to not have to stumble around and find hotel. And Nooo you cannot hear, feel or smell trains. Ryanairhotels have awesome deals too very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “def not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: bikerchick
Reviews.Content: think Travel Inn, only not as clean. We asked for some spare sheets on our first night and when I unfolded the it I nearly threw up- it was covered, and I mean covered in human poo. didn't any staff notice when they were carefully folding it up? the bathroom wasn't that clean either but it did have an impressive shower. On its posters it boasts about sound-proofed rooms, obviously this doesn't apply to all rooms as I could hear my neighbours on each side move about on their carpets. Luckily they were non-snorers and were very quiet. I have an othopedic (sp?) bed at home, but even I found the mattresses hard. I tried to check-out on the 1st night but I had paid upfront and the clerk refused to help. on the positive, the king size bed was the widest thing i've ever slept in. It was directly over train station and all major bus-stops. I'm glad I was only there for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be fairly easy to locate from the train station below. The room was nice and clean. The staff was friendly enough, but we found discrepancies in the information we were given about various things. We did find a nice place for dinner nearby- Pizza Roma. We had a nice meal there that was much more affordable than the hotel's restaurant. We did order room service one night, and it was very nice. If we went back to Barcelona, we would consider staying here again, but it might be better to stay somewhere a little more centrally located.
